price.review: Not so sure about all these great reviews, but that's just my opinion. First off, I liked the design, but felt very cheap, as in I could crush them without broken hand. The sound is decent. I expected way more from a $250 pair of headphones. The bass is lacking in my opinion. No matter what I put the settings on , the bass just wasn't quite there. My skull candy crusher wireless had way more bass for half the price. These Sony's were just not loud/clear enough, with the bass just not quite being there. Also, the active noise canceling is actually worse than the one on my MPOW H12 headphones, and they were $39!!! I guess you are paying for the name and features(with the sony app) , because I have no idea why these are so expensive. Either these reviews are mostly fake, or people just have low standards as far as headphones. I didn't even bother with call quality because these were such a disappointment, along with the fact that there's an annoying chime that constantly goes off while listening to music. Overpriced and overrated. Should be in the $60-$80 range.

At first it seems like a great price, on sale, but you can get it at a few other retailers. That said, the quality of the bass and overall sound is a disappointment. The noise canceling (N/C) is negligible at best. Im comparing to my BOSE noise-canceling headphones, and although the BOSE are twice the price (on sale) , it would be worth your while to simply step up and go with a better N/C type (BOSE or other) if you really want a quality set.  These SONY headphones arent worth the price, even on sale.

The headphones are pretty mediocre. While the bass is nice, and the battery life is great (30hrs is true), the sound cancelation and comfort are not the best. Comfort: Ive worn the headphones for about an hour, and the headphones are already making my head sore. Also, the sides are not padded so it makes all of the pressure of the headphones end up on the top of your head. Noise cancelation: The headphones dont cancel sound very well. I had the headphones at maximum cancelation and I could still hear my surroundings almost as if they were never on at all. All they do is make my ears feel as if theyre clogged (like they would on an airplane). Sound quality: If you like bass, these are pretty solid on the sound. The bass feels like a movie theaters bass around my ears. So they get a plus on that. Battery life: The battery life is great, 30hrs of life is absolutely correct. Sensors: I personally dislike the touch sensor for volume control. I get its Sony trying to make something new, but it is very inefficient. It makes adjusting the volume very tedious. For example, sometimes when I try to adjust the volume, sometimes I end up skipping the song. And if pretty much anything burshes up against the sensor (clothing, hair, etc), its going to change something. Price: Price is decent for this set. $150 is not too bad considering everything that comes with the headphones, but I would suggest getting a different model that isnt as finackey as this set is for the money.

This are great, Im in love with them since I got them, not the best on the market obviously but great for the price and very comfy. One problem I always had with good headphones similar to these is that I couldnt lay on my side because it would hurt my ears, however, these are surprisingly comfy even while laying on your sides. Would recommend them to anyone looking for a sort of low costing pair of quality headphones!

Well for starters I got these on a deal of the day and after using them for over a month I really really like them, sound quality is amazing, call quality is also amazing, nobody was able to tell I was on a my headphones. Now noise cancellation is not the best I feel my Samsung Galaxy Buds are much better in my opinion, but the call quality on the Galaxy Buds is extremely bad probably the one of the worst I've ever owned so I much rather use these because I'm always on my phone and these are much more comfy, ambient sound is also very good, much better than my Galaxy buds also surprisingly. So if I could go back in time would I buy these again? I sure would, I really enjoy using them and for the price its a no brainer, 5 stars buy them unless you need the very best noise cancellation than get the Sony WH1000XM3 those I hear are the best but I'm happy with these I sure you will be too.

For less than half the price of the Bose flagships, this pair had me even more impressed at the sound quality after I tweaked the equalizer settings (Excited preset FTW!). That bass thumps so hard and so clean, it makes the Bose QC35s sound flat by comparison. All with no loss in quality of the rest of the range. For $128, this was the buy of the year for me! Goodbye pretentious Bose insignia, hello anonymous and incredible sound you can feel!
I though they were ok. I am sure they pale in comparison to the Mx10000 or whatevr the other model is called. Were they worth the money no they wern't they were deffinitely kissing something

Pros: Price Sound Noise Cancelling Lightweight Cons Noise Cancelling (I know I put it twice) If you like the x3 sony headphones, these headphones are just as good, if not, better for the average listener. It even registers HiFi audio (which is a big deal if you have a high quality subscription that doesn't use compressed audio. High quality services that I know of are Tidal and Deezer. It's funny how the bass is EXTRA in the cheaper headphones. The x3's price is ONLY higher because of it's superior noise canceling feature, but I mean how quiet do you really want it to be? With these headphones, even playing a little bit of audio, you can barely hear your surroundings, if at all. The sound is so muted around you, it should not even bother your hearing sense after a certain decibel, scientifically speaking. I mean if you just want to blow the cash anyways, go for it, the copper on the band of the x3 looks like, and they look like they were built better, but these are also lighter, which means you can wear these longer without taxing your neck.
The cost is too high for what you get compared to cheaper taotronics and Cowin. mic sounds muffled, noise cancellation is terrible and sound is just ok

Ok. Not great. Do not pay full price. Reg price was $250. We got them on sale for $140. If you are looking at these at reg price, spend the extra $50 to get the better ones. My 13 year old bose have way better noise cancellation. We bought these for our son since he is remote learning. Noise cancellation on these is not very good. I expected better at a $250 price point. I guess they're ok for the sale price.

I purchased this product for a trip in December 2020 and less than one week later the sound would only work from one speaker. I have been unable to find any reviews where someone had a similar issue and the manual was useless. I played around with all the settings and unpaired and reset the headphones many times but nothing has worked. It is completely unacceptable for a product that cost this much performed correctly for less than a week. I do not recommend this product.

Okay for the price I paid, but could be better. Noise cancellation is good enough. Can't help but feel like they are always going to break however. They are made of a sturdy plastic, but still, it's plastic. Save your money for a better Sony model.

durable.review: My XB950BT headphones just broke on me so I decided to buy these first day as an upgrade. First off, the sound quality is very clear. I'm hearing details that I wasn't getting in the xb950bt headphones, especially in the mid to low frequencies. The XB950bt already have great quality audio so I was surprised by how noticeable of an upgrade these were. They managed to get a LOT of bass out of these without it effecting the mid at all. On the XB950bt, if you turned up the bass with the headphones app, the song would start to distort because the entire headphone would shake. Now the bass is much more solid and controllable while still sounding big. I listen to mostly EDM so the amount of bass is perfect. I did listen to some non EDM music and I can see why people who don't listen to bass music wouldn't like these. It's just a bit too in-your-face. You can turn the bass down in the app though. So if you're wanting a cheaper version of the Sony 1000xm3 but are afraid the bass will be too much, turning down the bass on the headphones app will make them sound more natural. Instruments sound as if they are really there in your head. The noise cancelling is nothing special. I don't have anything to compare to but it was only able to cancel the low frequencies while mowing the lawn. you can change how much cancellation there is and at one end it actually increases the noise around you. I like this feature because I want to be aware of my surroundings while in the house. I really like how you can cover the right ear to turn down the volume and it amplifies the sound around you so you can hear people talking to you. It's very fast and consistent but will look funny and rude to strangers if you try talking to them like this. The Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa button make these headphones feel modern. You hold it for the Assistant or you can fast click it to have your notifications read to you. Only problem is if you want to use it, you can't toggle noise cancelling because it uses the same button. You have to choose which one you want in the headphones app. I don't see why they couldn't add an extra button so there are no compromises; there's plenty of space for another. Or there could be a double click to toggle noise cancelling. There's an option called adaptive sound control that changes the noise cancelling intensity based on if you're sitting, walking, running, or in a moving vehicle. -This would be a very useful feature but every time you get up and move or sit down, it plays a bell notification and stops the music. You can't use adaptive sound control without it playing the sound and it makes it too annoying to use. Pretty unfortunate and hopefully they get rid of the notification with a software update or make it an option.- EDIT: there's a setting to turn off the bell notification and guides. You can change the spacial position of the sound with the headphones app. If that's useful to you, now you know. I've already accidently skipped the track a few times with the touch pad. You have to be careful touching the headphones on the right side since it doesn't use physical buttons, just swipe gestures. Hopefully I can get used to it and it not be a problem. The touch gestures seem to be pretty responsive so far, but it can be a little hard not to skip a track when you mean to turn the volume up. It also takes forever to adjust the volume any significant amount cause of how much motion each volume tick takes. If you need to quickly lower the volume, you'll have to use your phone. The main advantage to having swipe gestures is that it won't break. The volume up button stopped working on my xb950bt less than a year after I bought them and the track switch button was pretty finicky after two years. I'm only assuming these headphones will last longer because the touch screens on our phones don't just stop working out of nowhere. Also, I do like how easy it is to pause the music with a double tap on the right speaker. Just wish it was a little faster. EDIT: It's getting really frustrating how difficult it is to change the volume without skipping the track. Sometimes, even if I swipe directly up (which is for volume up) it STILL skips the track I'm playing. There's nothing more frustrating than getting into a song and wanting to turn it up only for it to skip the song you're jamming to. They really need to fix this in a software update and make it much more difficult to skip the track. At this point I only use my phone for volume changes which is annoying because the main reason I like the touch controls is because the volume button won't break like my last headphones. I've had some problems with the Bluetooth connection. It stopped working on me one time during a call and another time trying to play music. The call was on a Snapchat game with my music in the background. The other time it disconnected, there were two apps with audio playing at the same time. So I'm guessing it disconnects whenever there's an overload of input. My girlfriend told me the call quality was really good without me telling her I was using my new headphones so that's a plus. I'll update if it continues to disconnect. EDIT: I haven't had any more problems with this. I think it might have just been Snapchat calling that messed it up. They're not very comfortable for long periods of time. I've been wearing them all day today and honestly they're starting to hurt my head. I just put on the XB950BT and my head already feels better with them on. The xb900n presses around your ears a bit more and the cups aren't as big so the speaker touches my ears a little. They really just need bigger pads, even though it would ruin the thin look. Honestly, the best thing about these headphones are USB-C. I can finally charge my headphones with the same charger as my phone. This is a deal breaking feature and the biggest reason Id rather have these than the XB-950N1 despite its issues. These headphones feel very modern and stylish compared to the bulky and outdated XB950BT. The biggest problems can be fixed with software updates like the touch controls and double tapping Google Assistant to toggle noise cancelling. Hardware wise, these headphones are almost perfect with the biggest issues being the small ear pads and cheap plastic. I'm afraid these won't last longer than two years without cracking so I bought a 3 year protection plan with it.

First off these things are super comfortable. The first time I wore them, I feel asleep with them on. I mean in the bed under the covers sleep and woke and woke up and they were still in place on my head. The sound is great and the app makes it better as you have a lot ways you can tweak your sound to your liking for maximum bass, vocals, treble or whatever. The adaptive sound is cool to as you can focus sound in the headphones in any direction based on your environment and noise level. Battery life is the one thing I have not tested but I have no doubt that they can get the battery life that Sony claims which is 30 hours. I also like the fact that it has USB C fast charging, NFC and super fast and connectivity. I have not seen any lag issues either as the Bluetooth 4.1 or 4.2 can't remember which one it is seems to be super reliable. Buy these headphones at this great deal. Well worth it.

Very comfortable, great features. Love them so far. I hope they last a long time. Update: 1/8/20= I am now addicted to them. It will be hard to get along with me if something bad happens to them. Until the replacement arrives. After you experiment with all the different settings in the app, and try a flat equalizer setting on your phones built in equalizer. The headphones can impress you.UPDATE: 3/16/2020  Can't say enough about these headphones. I love everything about them. The sound, comfort, battery life, noise cancelling, color, Alexa voice control, touch control, everything! To me, they are perfect. Always did like Sony products.

Ever flown in a seat surrounded by parents with small children? Enough said, these things pay for themselves in flight satisfaction very quickly, or living in a small place in the city with lots of noise from the street, your roommate, or the upstairs neighbors.

Overall these are great headphones. The noise cancelling works very well for an office environment. The feature of cupping your hand over the earpiece to lower the volume and turn off noise cancelling is very handy. Sound quality is decent for the price of the headphones. I've owned several pairs of Sony wired over-the-ear headphones and I've never had any complaints about the sound quality of any of them. Battery seems to last a long time, I didn't charge them when I took them out of the box and was able to get a week of listening for a few hours a day and still have about 30% battery left. Range is really good, too. I have them paired to my Mac Mini in my office and I can walk to the break room in the next room without them dropping signal (but no further than that.) That's about 35 feet with 4 interior walls. My only two complaints are: After wearing for a few hours it does make my ears feel hot and start to sweat. They're comfortable to wear, but I have to take them off and let my ears cool down several times during the day. And the touch-sensitive controls on the ear piece are just weird and seem hit-or-miss. Often times when I take them off I end up restarting my music because my hand touched the "play" part of the controls. Good old fashioned buttons would have been a better design. Overall, for the price, I'm happy with them.

Love these. I bought these to replace my old MDRXB950BT and they are holding up just fine. Bass is fair and nothing to brag about. Same goes for the noise canceling. Sometimes bits of outside audio will still manage to get through. These are a good steal.

If the box had shown signs of previously been opened and the Amazon Inspected tag, I wouldn't have known they weren't new. No scratches, not wear. Was eager to try them out so the 7hr charge was a little long, but so worth it. Still learning the touch sound controls, but the noise cancelling - which I bought it for, is good. Box came with every thing in it including a carrying pouch but I bought my own hard case. So glad I didn't pay full price - great deal for something that's just like new.

This is the longest pair of headphones I ever had and like the rest I treated this one very badly lol but its still held up.
Well made, sturdy, great  sound quality.  I have had a variety of noise cancelling headphones and theses are by far the best.

I highly recommend Sony Noise-Cancelling Headphones as providing great sound, in a background-noise-cancelled world, all in a superior build quality.

The sound could be blasting and you can hear everyone around you clear as day. Kinda convenient but also can be annoying.

easy.review: It is easy to turn on and off and it automatically connects to the computer when turned on.  Noise cancellation is fair.  Others say the Bose is better, but much more expensive. The sound quality is great! The only problem is that it warm to wear, but other than that it is perfect!

quality.review: Great headphones and sound quality. I enjoyed the heavier effects of the base compared to my xm2's. Soft earcups and a sleek look. Just dont expect them to have equal or better noise cancellation. They are much worse in that regard. Going to save and may purchase the xm3's instead for that reason. You can tell there is noise cancellation but xm2's blow these headphones out of the water.
Overall, the noise cancelling is fantastic and really makes a difference. However, the lack of adjustability is uncomfortable on my head, and the app with it is almost useless.

Extra Bass ? ,I can't find it,now I have the M3 which are really good, these are good as well, tried the previous version in store and they have Bass, shouldn't have to tweek eq for bass, I found the bass

SOUND QUALITY AND BASS, I own a pair of Sony 1000XM3 and QC35, these definitely have more bass. They definitely don't sound as clear as either of the two, but they still sound great. They are less flat sounding and more lively and fun. If you want your ears to vibrate like the Skullcady Crushers, set the equalizer to Exited and set the headphones to Arena mode, then crank up the volume, while nowhere near as much vibration as the skullcandys, its there if youre into that. NOISE CANCELLING, I would say these headphones cancel about 60%-70% of the noise that the Bose QC35s and XM3s/Bose 700s cancel out (which is really good).  I would definitely place these in the top 10 noise cancelling headphones out there. However if you only want noise cancelling then you might want to look into the Sony 1000XM3 or Bose 700. With the XB900N you will still be able to hear some outside noise such as loud fans, chatter, etc at low volumes (40% or so) if you want to block out noise fully it is possible but you will have to crank them up to 70-80% volume. I listen to them at about 40% volume and its loud enough for me, while other headphones i have to set them near 80% volume. BLUETOOTH AND APP, these are very easy to connect to your devices, hold the power button for 7 seconds then they go into pairing mode, then just connect to them using your device...no hastle. The app also works flawlessly and let me tell you this app is no joke! - You can change the noise cancelling level (20 levels). - You can set between amazon alexa or google assistant - You can change the sound to come from front, front left/right, or rear left/right. - The have an equalizer which lets you adjust bass, mids, highs, etc. It also comes with some presets if you want to just boost bass, vocals, trebble etc. This equalizer really changes the way these headphones sound, this aint no gimmick! - Surround VPT, I dont know why this feature is not that popular but when you change it creates a feeling of surround sound, the settings are Arena, Concert Hall, Outdoor Stage, and Club. When you set the headphones to arena mode and you watch a movie it literally sounds like you have two soundbars in your ears, its insane that a simple setting on an app can make such a difference... these things sound like a movie theatre! I have owned many pair of headphones, and you get what you pay for. I would definitely say these are worth the $250 price tag. In a nutshell... Those who want a good pair of headphones and want to save $100 buy the XB900Ns. If you want basically double the noise cancelling, and a cleaner sound (less bass) get the Sony XM3s. Cant go wrong with either, both are great.

The deep bass was amazing! Plus, the headphones play HD and Ultra HD songs perfectly. i strongly recommend Amazon's new high definition audio service. Amazon music and Sony combine to make a great wireless audio experience. The sound quality is superb and the battery lasts forever (almost)! it automatically tells you when there is 10% battery life left and you need to charge the headphones.  Of course the sound is great even when the environment is noisy with noise cancelling technology.
Had it for a week. Worked well up until it stopped turning on and when I tried charging it, it would charge for a minute then stopped

La comodidad, despus de dos horas comienzan a dolerte un poco las orejas te los tienes que quitar y dejar descansar tus orejas por unos minutos.

I was hesitant to spend $200 on a set of headphones, but I'm glad I splurged. It feels great not to have to untangle a wire every time I want to listen to something, and the noise cancelling makes a welcome difference when I'm between classes at my university. If the "Extra Bass" makes you question if these are right for you, you might want to look elsewhere, but I find that these provide a rich sound in the low end without overpowering higher notes, at least without any additional equalizer tweaks. While the noise cancellation is good, don't expect miracles. If I'm listening to something quiet, or there's a particularly loud noise, I can still hear the outside world. On the other hand, wind can be a real issue when wearing these outside. The noise cancellation's attempt to counter the wind really just ends up with me hearing the wind blowing through the microphones, in which case it's better to just turn it off. The ambient sound pass-through mode is good in theory, but in practice you'll have to turn down your music volume for it to make much difference. Thankfully, putting your hand over the right earcup lowers your music volume and automatically turns on ambient sound mode, which is incredibly convenient when you need to listen to someone briefly without having to take them off your ears or pause your music. The battery life is as good as promised, it feels like I never need to charge them. That's good, since while these headphones have a 3.5 mm cable jack, and they support passive audio, the sound quality is absolutely terrible without the battery charged and the set powered on. When I say it's bad, I mean it's worse than any $15 pair of cheap earbuds, which is really disappointing.
I ordered these for my daughter.  She said the sound quality and noise cancellation were awful.  She had to return them.

Sony never fails to impress with superior products and these headphones are impressive with great Bottom, mids and highs-and ambient sound as well. I own a lot of different headphones and these are my new faves

Heres my direct report. Im in LA I frequent city walk amc for their sound system!!! When you watch any movie you feel it!!! These headphones sound same as if there!!! High quality feel, all the great new features of his higher priced counterpart but not the price. I am in love!!!!

I will start out saying that I am wouldn't consider myself an audiophile, but I do love great sounding headphones.... I will do some comparisons to other headphones just to give an idea of how good I think these are. These have became my daily drivers after I listened to them the first time.  I have used them for music, gaming, and watching videos.  I did not notice any latency with my Note 9 when I was watching videos, but did notice quite a bit while using an Iphone XS max. The sound quality to me, is amazing, not the greatest but still, so very good. I compared sound quality to my Bose QuietComfort 35 II (which have probably the best all around, balanced sound) These still have very good quality, sometimes the bass is a little overwhelming, even when it is turned all the way down. The noise canceling is good-ish. It works for the most part and it works a whole lot better than my JBL Everest Elite 300, usually NC gives me a headache, but these (after about 3 hours of use) did not bother me at all. My previous daily drivers were Sony XB950N1. Which is another one of Sony's extra bass headphones, and these 900n's blow those out of the water when it comes to sound quality, controls and feature.  Sony decided to mimic these headphones with their high end wh-1000xm3 models when it comes to controls.  With only a power buttons and a NC button now you use gesture controls to change songs, play/pause your music, change tracks, lower and raise the volume, and answer your phone calls.  To increase volume, swipe up with one finger on the right ear cup, pause/play, tap it, and if you cover the entire cup with your hand, it will lower the music, and let the mics let the outside noise in so you could talk to someone. Overall these are great headphones, there is little room for improvement at this price range, and a very strong addition to Sony's great arsenal of headphones, speakers and earbuds.

If your an iphone user, download the app and connect them to your phone through the app and then go into the equalizer in your apple music (if you have apple music) and turn bass boost on and max the bass on the equalizer in the sony app and the bass is amazing is vibrates my ears a little but not as much as my crusher wireless, Noise canceling, its decent but its way better then just noise isolation from the crusher wireless they didnt have any noise canceling at all but those are $150 with rattling head bass which is amazing, The vocals are clear no tinny vocals, and no ear piercing highs. NO cabin pressure at all from the noise canceling which is amazing! And i havent experienced the swipe motions randomly in the cold weather like it doesnt randomly swipe left or right when you arent even touching it, and i heard that was a problem for the 1000xm3s in cold weather Type c charging is expected and is included which is nice even though im an iphone user lol ONLY NEGATIVE is that i have to take it off every hour cause the tips of my ears start to hurt and the top of my head hurts even with the nice padding on the top of the headband which is wierd

Ok first off this is my first noise cancelling headset so I can't compare it against the others. With that said, this headset is amazing. Sound is much better than the others I own and I really like the 3 different modes on the noise cancelling. Apparently one mode enhances outside noise so you can put this on and still keep safe around traffic outside. I have only used this mode indoors and it does seem to enhance the sound of my keyboard typing sounds. The base on this is amazing too!

I keep trying to find some sort of noise reduction to handle high pitch chihuahua puppy barks. The noise level around me is hard to sleep through. Unfortunately all I read about noise cancelling is there really good about shutting out low frequency sounds. Isn't there anything out there that gets rid of the really high pitched sounds? Otherwise I really love these and I've had several different sets of headphones. These are unique because the right hand side of the headphones ex like a touchpad and you can just adjust volume or fast forward or shutting them on or off just by the direction you rub your finger on the side. This is really a unique idea and I really like it. I just wish someone could come up with headphones you can sleep on your side with and I would be in Nirvana. Definitely worth it, at least it knocks out most of the noise.

I got these on a flash deal with 60% discount! So worth it!! LOVE THEM! They automatically adjust between when Im listening to music or on a video call to provide the best sound, the profiles are great and love that I can customize the equalizer! I didnt go for the five stars because depending on the settings it sometimes sounds a bit flat but nothing too bad, just not 5 star worthy

Use it every night at the gym, that being said it doesnt stay on my head as well as Id like it too. Yes I know its an over the ear, supposed to be big and bulky, just didnt wanna have to readjust after EVERY SET... 5 pounders rotator Cuff warm up? Readjust Put your weights away? Readjust Taking pre work out? Readjust ... GOTTA PEE??? ...... readjust ... Noise canceling 3.8/5 seen better but does dang good job for money Also I will give a 5/5 for the fact that I can put my hang over one ear and the headphones will play whatever sound is outside through the mic into the speakers... pretty cool feature for when I wanna discreetly hear couples fight at the gym... nice

They are super comfortable to wear! They are noise cancelling and they dont look as bulky on you as you would think. The quality is amazing - that bass! Its just great and I recommend if you cant afford those Bose headphones which I originally wanted but was out of my budget.

These are by far the best headphones I have purchased. Great sound, soft ear pads, long battery life, and so much more... These headphones do so much, I highly recommend them. I am a Bass Guy and these do not disappoint.

Very high-quality headphones from Sony. Using headphones is only a positive experience! The headphones have clear sound with a large volume margin, and even at maximum power, distortion does not occur. It can be used with a smartphone or PC. I bought from Amazon at a very nice price. The only remark is the long-term charging from the PC.

I got this to give as a gift to my bf and he loved it. My apology to the sweat shop workers at Amazon who had to make this. I feel bad I supported a company that openly abuses staff. another issue is it doesn't cancel noise.

I have been looking and researching for a quality wireless noise cancellation headphone without having to spend a fortune for several months.  I came across the Sony WH-XB900N and I was hooked.  As a musician I enjoy extra bass in the sound as you are not listening to the music, you are experiencing it.  If you want to hear the song as the artist intended it the Sony WH-XB900N is the right choice.

Best money I ever spent!! Noise cancellation is top notch. Sound quality is top notch. So many positives for a decent price. I've purchased Beats headphones before and these Sony headphones are better!!

Really enjoy these, noise cancellation is great especially on planes and I love the extra bass with the XB line. Really can't go wrong, I have owned the last 3 models of these headphones and I am always impressed.

These headphones are amazing. I decided to go for around ear wirless because I lost my galaxy buds twice and couldnt trust myself to buy wireless earbuds again and risk losing them. These headphones sound amazing, and the app is very useful. The controls on the right ear are very convenient. The noise cancelling works very well and they are very comfortable, I usually wear them for 4-5 hours at a time, and the battery is amazing, got them last week, charged them to 100, and theyre still over 50 after a week of regular use. Highly recommend

Arrived as adThe new Sony WH-XB900N wireless headphones are an outstanding option for a comfortable listening experience at home, traveling or in a noisy office. They incorporate very effective noise suppression and echo canceling systems, have easy-to-operate controls and a very long battery life. Their quality is evident in every feature and they a part of the well-regarded Sony Extra Bass family. Here are the key features:  Sony WH-XB900N noise-canceling over-the-ear Bluetooth headphones  Ergonomic, fully adjustable over-ear, closed dynamic headphone  40 mm dome driver for maximum bass and very accurate wide frequency response  Noise-canceling/suppression technology helps block external noises, may be switched on or off  Monitor function allows ambient sound to be easily heard while wearing headphones, may be switched on or off  Bluetooth 4.2 reception range up to 50 feet, NFC pairing connection option, support aptX codec  Built-in microphone for making and receiving phone calls  Touch control on side of right earphone to raise/lower volume, next/previous track selection  Power, Bluetooth pairing, Monitor and Noise Cancel buttons on left earphone  Rechargeable internal lithium ion power source: 6 hours to fully charge with included USB-C connection cable  Headphones will operate 30+ hours continuously from a full charge, 16 day standby time, customizable auto-off timer  Can also operate without using any power by connecting an included 4.1 foot 3.5 mm stereo cable to left earphone  3.5 mm (headphone) male-to-male 50 connection cable included  20  20,000 Hz audio frequency range, less than 1% THD distortion  Sony Headphone Connect app provides graphic equalizer and presets  Easy to follow illustrated quick set-up guide  Foldable design for compact storage  Size: 5.5 inches by 6.6 inches by 3.5 inches  Weight: 9 ounces  Soft pouch with drawstring closure included  One year warranty on parts and labor Included in the box are the headphones, instructions, a short USB-C charging cable, a 50 inch long 3.5 mm direct-connect wire cable and a nice soft pouch. The quick set-up guide is comprehensive with step-by-step instructions for using the headphones, a trouble-shooting checklist, technical specifications and detailed explanations for using each feature. The headphones have a non-reflective black finish, substantial bass-producing drivers and super-soft memory-foam cushions on each headphone for superb comfort and noise isolation. They fold flat to enable compact storage and to easily fit into a purse, drawers, etc. The Sony WH-XB900N has a look of quiet quality and business elegance without flashy excess. First step is to charge the headphones. Just attach the USB-C charging cable, plug it into your computer or a USB outlet and LED lights will go out when they are fully charged (which may take 4- 6 hours when fully discharged.) A red LED light next to the charging port goes out when the unit is fully charged. The stated music playing time of thirty hours seems conservative since I found the headphones would operate for nearly forty hours before fading out. The customizable auto-off feature aids this very long battery life. Next, press the power button to turn them on  an audio prompt indicates when the power is on or off. Pair the earphones with your phone or other source via Bluetooth or NFC. An audio prompt guides you, but my phone paired them very quickly and without drama. A blue LED indicates the connection has been made. The connection remained very solid throughout my home, up to nearly 50 feet. The headphones are fully adjustable and the very soft pads completely and comfortably enclose even the largest ears. The Sony WH-XB900N are the most comfortable headphones I have ever worn. They are light (9 ounces) and have plenty of adjustment range to enable a perfect fit. The earphone pads are fairly large (about 4 inches tall and 3 inches wide) so they qualify as over ear and they provide excellent sound isolation. You can wear them for many hours in perfect comfort and your ears will never complain. Even without the noise-canceling function most external sounds are blocked. Pressing the Custom (automatic noise canceling) button turns on that feature and there is an audio announcement that it is active (or that it has been turned off.) The ANC technology is very effective for mid-frequency noise. I turned on both my shower and bathroom sink faucet and the noise (which would normally be very loud) was just a faint hiss which I could easily ignore while listening to the music. Even without music playing the noise canceling feature was pretty effective. Further, you can adjust the degree of noise cancellation using the Headphone Connect app. These would be great on a noisy airplane ride! The Sony WH-XB900N headphones have a very accurate reproduction of music from bass through mid-range notes and on to the highest frequencies. You can modify the sound contour/response by utilizing the Sony Headphone Connect app which features a full equalizer, a number of surround sound presets and sound positioning controls. For those who like heavy bass these are an ideal choice. If you want to cut back the bass the equalizer on the app will do that very effectively. I played every range of music, from classical, blues, hard rock, jazz and a full range of vocals (opera through folk ballads) and these fine headphones never disappointed me. The sound quality is just beautiful. Sony has positioned these headphones to deliver premium sound and features at a mid-range price. Yes, you might find slightly better headphones but only if you are willing to spend at least 50% more, and even then most users would not really appreciate any difference in sound or features. Like all good earphones these will respond to various voice commands, allow you to interact with Siri, take calls, etc. Each earphone has some controls. The right side has a nice touch pad which will raise/lower volume, skip tracks (forward and backward), pause and repeat tracks and has a microphone for use during calls. The left side turns the earphones on/off, handles Bluetooth pairing, activates the noise cancelation feature and also takes calls. One very clever feature is Quick Attention which shuts off noise cancellation and lowers music volume when you touch the right headphone, enabling you to easily hear outside sounds (such as someone speaking to you), and then resumes noise cancellation and music volume when you remove your hand. Bottom line - the Sony WH-XB900N noise-canceling Bluetooth headphones are an excellent value for discerning music fans who want a very comfortable headset, superb noise isolation and beautiful sound reproduction. They are a perfect choice for traveling and would pass boring hours in airports and on planes with gold stars for quality, sound level and range. I am happy to award this fine product a full five stars and my full, unqualified endorsement. Buy these if you love music and want sweet isolation from the nasty noises of the world!vertised and highly recommended.

These headphones are great. Connection is stable, sound and bass are good and the noise canceling works. My head is quite small and I dislike that they are a bit loose on my head, it feel comfy when I stand but I always feel like they are gonna fall off if I move too fast with my head down. Also instinctively I try to readjust them by touching the round parts and those sensors get activated automatically. So now I need to learn how to touch them which is annoying. The design is simple, plastic seems very durable, soft leather like details around ears and on the top of headband could get damaged quite easily so I would recommend using a protective case. To me this design is a bit too simple, although I love minimalistic style, I wish it could be more sophisticated. My husband likes the size because his head is large. It seems like he was annoyed with sensors too at first but now getting used to them. Battery is fine, weve been using them for a few hours every day for like a week and didnt need to charge it yet.

The sound quality is very good for the money, I got these for $150. Bass is good and it can be adjusted using the Sony app, also you can use the equalizer but it's not the best eq. I have owned headphones such as v-moda lp2 and athm50x, and these Sony are not bad compared to those. I am giving 5 stars because features (e. g. battery life, and controls) are good and sound quality is good. Also, compared to other headphones, these aren't heavy.

I purchased these headphones as my first entry into the world of "good, noise cancelling headphones". Before this pair, my max spend on headphones would be around $25-50 (and that'd be stretching it) The ones I have had before would have decent sound, nothing amazing but still decent nonetheless and noise cancelling would be a complete joke. My office environment is fairly noisy and I commute on a light rail to and from work. In addition to that I was looking for something that produced better sound so I could better tune out the distractions and focus on my work. I didn't have the money for the top-of-the line headphones (such as the Sony WH-1000XM3) so my review won't be comparing these headphones to the top of line ones. I don't like how you have to reset the bluetooth sync every time you connect  to a new device, but I compensate for that by only listening to them via bluetooth on my phone and I hard wire them into my computer by an audio cable. I do want to mention that the audio quality is far superior on my phone then on the computer as a result of the phone app, but my computer is a work supplied computer for work and not for listening to music so the audio is baseline at best. If we were to upgrade the audio card on the computer I'm confident it would be far better experience. I wish that there was some sort of water proofing, especially for the price I paid. I also wish that bluetooth paired better between devices as I would love to listen to other devices using these headphones. I've had some issues with phone calls while using these, the wind noise is much more pronounced and the mics tend to pick up everything around me. I once made the mistake of talking on a phone in the stairs and the quality was soooo poor that the support representative of the company I was talking to just hung up after telling me to call back cause he couldn't understand me hahaha (I have had many successful phone calls in the same stairs so I know it was the headphones). I do feel like I'm yelling when I'm using these phones I feel much more self conscious then I did with my previous headphones I used for phone calls The sound quality of these, especially when used on my phone with the sony headphone app on it, is AMAZING great Bass replication, the highs are not piercing as well. It is a truly enjoyable experience. Overall, I really enjoy these headphones. The sound quality is incredible, the noise cancellation is exactly what I was hoping for, and if I have something playing through the headphones (music, movie, audio of some sort) you hardly hear anything but your audio which is incredible! There have been times that I just listen to nothing and use them to help keep the office quieter. I absolutely do not regret getting these.

It's been a month since I got my XB900N, I bought them for 148$ on Cyber Monday. I actually wanted the 1000mx3, but couldn't afford the price, so I opted for these ones, and I have to say I don't regret my purchase. I needed the noice canceling to be able to study and read in loud environments and it has worked great for that. The sound quality is excellent and the duration of the batteries are amazing(it also comes with an aux cable that you can plug in and saves a lot of battery power, while maintaining the gestures that allows you to listen to the outside). They fit tight and comfortable. As a bass head myself, I thought that the bass.was going to kick louder in the standard set up. But with the Sony's headphones app, you can achieve that ideal EQ.

THESE ARE A AMAZON EXCLUSIVE AND THEY ARE GREAT YOU GET A TON OF QUALITY FOR THE MONEY IVE NOTICED THESE FLUCTUATE IN PRICE FROM 249.00 TO A LITTLE UNDER 200.00 THEY ARE A GREAT BUY AT 200.00 I  USE THEM FOR ENTERTAINMENT  MOVIES MUSIC AND GAMES THEY HAVE BEEN GREAT Amazon Exclusive

This thing is amazing if you want to workout with. Has great bass that maintains sound quality no matter what. Can get loud as hell if needed and has unbelievable controls through apps. Can spend hours just fiddling with this thing and trying out different settings. Noise canceling is amazing. Literally could not complain about a single thing. Comfortable as can be and I never have that feeling that usually comes with wearing over ear headphones for a while. Charge lasts forever. They look super nice on me and feel great too. Would recommend to anyone.

I've had them for a few months and they're Absolutely great sounding for Bluetooth headphones in this price range with the feature set. Pros: The bass is good and the cup shape is more comfortable than Sony's other pair with round cups ( although I really miss the supper think cushions)  they're also really portable for over ear headphones. I can either fold them up and put them in my bag, or tilt one of the earcups and put it in my jacket pocket if I don't have my bag with me. Cons: Pausing with the double tap feature is cool, but honestly it gets accidentally activated too easily sometimes and they can sometimes end up sitting on a table playing music because I somehow managed to activate them again while putting them down. I do wish the nose cancelling wasnt on by default. I've found that long term digital noise cancelling starts to hurt my ears and potentially damage them so I'd prefer to leave it off most of the time.

First off, I'd like to comment that I consider these headphones to be a touch expensive. I had shopped around for a while before settling on these, I picked them up because they were advertised for thier long battery life, good sound fidelity, bass and USB C recharging. I had purchased several cheaper headphones in the past few months but was ultimately disappointed with each. What can I say about these other then HOW AWESOME THEY ARE? Well, the bass really is amazing, if I'm listening to a heavy song it's like my entire head is shaking, it's an experience. The sound fidelity is great and far exceeds all previous headphones I've used, everything sounds crisp; none of that dull foggy sound you get from poor audio. The battery life is extreme, I never expected to get undersold on how long they last, I use these things at work and need to charge them every other shift, I work 12 hour shifts. The interactability on these is... what you would expect from a pair of headphones, the right ear has a seires of motions you can make to lower and raise the volume, attenuate the volume, pause, play, skip or goback. The left ear has two smaller buttons, a power button and a button to cycle through the various noise cancelation setups, I particularly like the mode that takes in and amplifies the surrounding audio so you can still hear things. My two gripes: First, I wish the buttons and interactability was truely customizable, there is a small amount of customization available but nothing extensive; particularly I wish I had the option to ceate a PTT button. Second, I wish I knew what a good pair of headphones were like, I would have purchased an even fancier pair from Sony. I didn't think it mattered that much, I was wrong.

The Sony WH-1000XM3 wireless noise canceling headphones are the most incredible headphones I have ever used! Not only are they supremely comfortable to wear, but the sound quality and active noise canceling are far superior to any other premium headsets that I have used. Super lightweight and excellent sound from these Sony over the ear headphones. All day battery life and comfort. Ears stayed cool during full day use while connected to my windows 10 desktop. The headphones ship with a great carrying case, a USB-C fast charging cable, an audio cable for wired connection and instructions/paperwork. The headphones fold up perfectly to fit in the case which is a good size for traveling. The came fully charged and ready to go, so all you need to do is (optional really, as they headphones will connect to your bluetooth device anyway) download the Sony Connect app and set up the earphones. So far, after using it for 10 days, i had no problem either with connecting them to my laptop or cell phone or sound quality. I like the adaptive mode, it adjusts the noise canceleing while you are walking or running.
liked my color scheme of mine as it hugs the form of your cranium slim sleek design with good sound performance and noise cancellation rated a 4 out 5 on effectiveness . Great headphones.

This is perfect for you bass junkies. Good quality. Cool features. Great (if not the best) noise cancelling. I was looking for a more balanced sound, where highs and miss were almost or just as important as bass.

This device connects to my iPhone so effortlessly when my other bluetooth devices require extra steps. The sound quality is excellent. These are fairly light and comfortable over-the-ear headphones. On the downside, the charging port is a non-standard plug on a short USB cord. If you lose this, you can't just replace it with a standard USB charging cord; I assume that you have to buy a replacement from Sony. As for volume control - I don't think there is one on the unit.

I've had these for about three months. I love them, like, 70% of the time. They charge fast, fit well for 7+ hours on my face, and sound pretty good. However, if I move my phone to my right pocket, it no longer has a stable connection. It'll drop out every .5 seconds, skip for .1 seconds, and pick back up. It does this CONTINUALLY until I can find a pocket or place to put it where it's closer to the left ear? I've tested it with multiple phones, and with the settings to prioritize connectivity on -- same issue. I was happy with these for about two months, but now I can barely use them because of how annoying it is to hear my stuff pause/play randomly, all day, every day.

Ive had lots of different headphones and most of them seem to have similar performance and sound quality.  Sure some have better bass, some are a little cleaner, and some are a little weak or OP in a particular range. I was able to hear a difference the very first time I listened.  The sound is just so pleasing, I dont know any other way to say it but they make me smile everytime I listen to them. I listen to music, audiobooks, sports broadcasts... its all good. The app is actually really useful, there are some settings that can change the direction the sound comes from (in front, behind, at an angle, or directly into your ears).  Also has pre programmed equalizers and basic effects.  I never thought I would use the app, but they really do unlock some useful features on these headphones. Definitely my favorite pair of headphones, comfortable, and great sound quality. Other headphones:  marley positive vibes 2, skull candy hash 3, Cowin E7 pro, Cowin E8, Sony PlayStation gold, Tao Tronics TT-BH060. Of all the rest the Tao Tronics were the only pair with sound quality approaching the Sonys.  But the Sonys are still noticeably better in sound quality and noise cancellation.

I bought these when they were on sale, but still the most money I've ever put into headphones. It's been several months and they still are the best sounding devices I've ever listened to music with. Pros: -Call quality is excellent and the other person can hear you clearly. -Noise cancellation works well enough that I don't hear anyone coming into my work space. -Battery life is outstanding and lasts over a week of regular usage before it needs charging. -Volume and FWD/BKWD controls work every time. -Ear cups fit well around my slightly larger ears and don't cause any discomfort for long periods of wear. Cons: -Pause and play control works sparingly to the point that I'm tapping all around the middle of the earpiece to pause or resume my music. -While noise cancellation works well, I work in a loud environment at times and it won't make very loud and consistent noises much quieter. -This one might just be a "me" thing, but if I'm moving about while wearing these for an extended period of time the headphones can get warm enough that the sides of my face start sweating. The pros greatly outweigh the cons and even at their regular price, these would be well worth it to me. Highly recommend.
A truly terrible product. The battery conked out after month one, rendering the unit unchangeable. Then, it ceased to function when plugged in a couple months later. A total waste. Stay away.

This was my birthday gift. I love it. I got very good price. Its high quality, very light weight. Its very simple to use. Only thing, When Im using it during yoga, my right shoulder touches, it changes or stops. I think this is touch sensitive. That is the only thing I need some getting used to. Otherwise I love it. Its comfortable and I forget that I have this on. I highly recommend it.

These are simply the best headphones Ive ever used.  So good I bought a 2nd pair for a family member.  Noise canceling is amazing, and based on professional reviews seems to be best in class.  I can sit on a plane near engines and not even notice. When pared via Bluetooth the on headset controls work very well, the ability to change volume, skip, rewind, pause, etc with touch on the headphones works very well.  The ability to cup an ear and have noise canceling stop so you can speak with and hear a person is a great feature - really appreciate this for when the flight attendant comes by. Finally, just used these on a phone call for the first time this past week and it worked very well.  The caller could hear me well so the microphone on the headset seemingly works well. All around a great buy and headset.

Everyone I know has the $399 sony headphones for sound quality and better noise cancellation. I've tried it and it definitely is great quality and noise cancellation is awesome, but THESE headphones are what I need because I would rather feel my music than super noise cancellation. With the extra bass feeling and sound, I can't even tell when I have noise cancellation turned on or not. I can't hear anything outside of my headphones at all. I would recommend this to my friends and a now a few of my friends wish they bought these instead of their $399 sony headphones.

...So I can't speak as to durability just yet. But these are dope for sure. The bass can be a bit much on songs if you listen to them in the lower range, but there is an eq in the app. So it's there if you need it (can't say the same for other headphones) and isn't if you dont. I haven't owned any of the other high end headphones but I can say these have a volume range you aren't finding under $100. The clarity is amazing too, I can understand words in slightly stoopid's "2am" I could never decipher before. The hand controls arent just cool, they're convenient. Skipping through a lot of songs in one go is the only time is prefer traditional controls. The ANC is great, I've heard it doesn't compare to the 1000's though. I'd imagine that's true because while it's better than any I have, it isn't mind blowing like the rest of the headphones features. If I'm on my porch with the 30" fan blowing it will block out all sound and bring the fan to a low roar.

These are great. The noise-canceling is sensational, it works really well on human voices, but you can still hear them a little in the background. But if you listen to something softer like classical, they might not work as well. I love loud rock music, as a disclaimer. The volume control is also good, one simple swipe and it works with ease. But then, the sound quality, that is something special. These fit on my head perfectly! Highly recommend! But my one complaint? It is a little tricky to remember which button is which. You also have only one custom button, which is either Google, Alexa, or ambient noise. But nonetheless, these are the best headphones I've owned. Edit: 1. Another complaint: It "smartly" decides when you're standing up, sitting down, walking, etc., and it will give you a ping when it thinks you've changed your action. I hate that. Most of the time, you haven't even moved at all. 2. I'm returning them, to get the XM3's. Watch for my review there.

Everything OK with the product. I like the sound quality and the noise cancelling works, it's not the best but for the price is good to me. Also I like the design and the material. I recommend to download the Sony app "Headphones Connect".

Love there headphones. I use them for calls and to listen to music. Great sound all around . Still getting used to the controls on the side. The charge lasts long and the quality is awesome. Very happy with this purchase.
Very good head phone for the price and good battery life. Its definitely not as good as bose quiet comfort if you are comparing it but it good for its price range.

I have tried to return this product for four weeks.  Amazon received product over three weeks ago, according to UPS, and does not acknowledge it in their system.  Hopefully corrected soon.  Functioned well in all modes-no complaint there.  Just rather painful after five minutes around the temples.  Tried all sorts of positions, but a no-go.  I think it is merely a matter of being a bit too tight around my head, rather than a problem with cushion softness.  Tried the 1000's, and have been relatively comfortable.  Less bass heavy.  No accounting for taste, but please account for head diameter!

The item is fine, when it works. But mainly it doesn't, alas, and after a month or so, I've had the pleasure of listening to music perhaps twice.  I charge it, and occasionally the light flickers red--which means it's charged. But mainly no light flickers and no charge is produced.  I wasted a bit of money on it, which was spent as a present for myself as I self-sequestered at home.  Either I received a dud, or it's a very bad product.

So far I have had these headphones for about two month and I use them occasionally. For the most part, these headphones are really good. The only negative thing I have found so far is using the volume control. You have to tap the side of the headphones and then run your finger either up or down depending on what you what you want to do with the volume. Sometimes it take me several time of attempting this before I can get the volume control to engage. Other than that, I have found these headphones to be confortable with great sound quality. I would recommend these headphones to my friends.

I love these headphones! Good sound, good noise canceling, good comfort, great battery, all at a good price. I had an upscale set of Bose headphones before these and the sound was constantly cutting out. These don't quite compare for sound depth, but I bet the next model up does. I wear these all day at work swapping seamlessly between music and calls.  The mic has good call quality. The control surface is great and intuitive. I love the "listen to ambient" gesture for a quick word with my coworkers. And the 30  hour batter life is astounding. Plug it in at night and go all day. So glad I picked these up.

I just bought these Sony headphones WH-XB900N model and I have to say they left me amazed. I am someone who usually has headphones or earphones in so sound quality to me is important. I had bought the Studio 3 beats earlier this year but I was never satisfied with the beats I thought they could be louder and more comfortable for $360, And it was probably a big mistake because I had not done my research on these instead oh well. I got these Sony headphones $100 cheaper on a deal here on Amazon. In reality the Sonys sound better, last longer, more comfortable, and the price is lower!

Noise cancelation is pretty stellar. I live in a very noisy house with 5 people and it lets me do my college stuff in silence even if Im not listening to anything. Sound quality is great (Im not an audiophile). I can walk like 20 feet away with no audio disturbances over Bluetooth (I havent tested farther). I got these for $150 in the used like new selling option on here. I recommend buying it like that its completely new just with slightly damaged packaging.
I've Bose and Sony headphones, but this one blows them all away! The sound, noise cancellation, and mix of treble and bass are amazing. I recommend this product.

I bought these as a birthday gift for my wife.  She has seldom taken them off since.  They are comfortable, have almost perfect noise cancellation, and the sound quality is top-notch.  And also a biggie -- they have a very LONG battery life between charges.  The only drawback is that I have to really shout at her to get her attention when she's wearing these.

I almost listened to the small 2 or 1 star reviews and im SO glad i didn't listen to what they were saying!  These are the most amazing headphones EVER.  They versatility is amazing, you can make it sound like your in a concert (it's ridiculous).  They are also sooooo noise proof i wear them in a silent library on full blast and no one hears my music.  GET THEM NOW DON'T QUESTION IT!!!!!

I have to admit that these headphones are amazing! I'm a bit of a bass-head, love heavy metal concerts and EDM! I love that feeling of the bass pounding through your chest! These have the feeling of a subwoofer on your head! The closest comparison is when I had the Beats by Dre Studios. I've also had JBL and Sennheiser over the ear headphones. Absolutely Love these and the variety of listening options! Would highly recommend! Very pleased and so will you! God bless!
My sons favorite Christmas gift! When hes using them on road trips, were now unable to hear what hes listening to. So its a win win situation for everyone.
Its very light and has great sound quality. I bought it for online school and so far I love it. Really functional.
These have great sound and are easy to use.  Almost as nice as the very expensive headphones on the market.
Sound quality excellent Noise canceling very good Good Bass but not too much Rarely listen at max volume Battery life, no complaints Bluetooth range
Sound quality is excellent; noise cancellation is functional but still lets in some sound. Still an amazing pair of headphones, best I've ever had!

A full range sound to satisfy my eclectic range of musics. The active noise reduction is excellent for most situations. My neighbors dog being the exception, it seems to reach a perfectly horrible pitch and timber  that are deadened but not to be defeated by the noise canceling. The only issue i have had is if i wear them for an extended period, more then six hours, the foam will compress enough that the ear-phones will press against my ear causing some discomfort. Its just how my ear is shaped and easily remedied by removing the phones for a time to let the foam decompress for a few minutes. I am on the whole very happy with my purchase.

I'm coming from Bose's top of the line corded noise canceling and these are just fantastic. Their noise cancellation may not quite achieve what Bose has but they're just fantastic for the price. I love them so much I purchased a pair for my daughter in college and offered to purchase my high school son a pair also. And I'm cheap, like Clark Howard cheap.

Purchased this for my wife, and she loves them! Really nice sound, with crisp highs and deep, booming lows. These really can actually be compared with the premium headsets in the WH1000XM# line, and while they don't quite meet that level of refinement, they definitely hold their own, especially when the difference in price is taken into account. They also have the really useful touch controls the higher-priced models do, including the easy ambient sound mode you can activate simply by cupping one side of the headset. Overall, I'd prefer the premium headset of course, but at $100 less, they're a great option if you don't need the absolute best.

It started great but within few weeks sound started breaking and it is very strange for me because its a SONY product. No doubt they are lacking in quality. I just wasted my money on these. I will not buy any of SONY product from now on.
Great for use in bed when someone wants to sleep.  Great sound.
Have to crank up super loud to drown out lawn mower. The touch controls are a little tricky to work. The bass overpowers.

PROS: -Great sounding headset -Noise cancelling gets the job done well but isn't perfect -Ability to increase ambient noise through app settings -Touch controls on right cuff for music control (ability to temporarily increase ambient noise is great!) -When swiping up or down for volume control you can hold it to continuously increase or decrease (Warning: this happens fast and can be hard to get the timing down if you are not watching the volume numbers) -Deep bass -Comes with app allowing for highly adjustable music experience -App has setting for different "music settings" allowing you to feel like your in a club or live concert -Dual microphones making headset very viable for answering calls -Works great as a gaming headset for my Xbox but can't seem to get the microphones working with it..? -INSANE battery life and also quickly charges (have never had the battery die on me due to charging it like once every other day) -Fits larger heads (I wear a size 8 fitted cap for reference which is the largest hat stores offer in my area ) -Can wear for long sessions if you set the sizing correctly CONS: -Microphones remain on with noise cancelling feature turned on making a loud rustling noise during slight winds outdoors and brushing your fingers over the microphone causes the same effect...(Do not understand why this is a thing when I have ambient turned off??) -Does not have the wind reduction setting in the app like the more expensive version of these does, making me think the microphone issues could easily be fixed with a future update -Swiping for music control can be off if headset is slightly eschew on your head, but very minor inconvenience -Lying or sitting  with the right cuff pushed against something can cause accidental inputs but I have very rarely had this happen CONCLUSION: Great sounding bluetooth headset with rich sound and booming bass. If app and software gets updated in the future would definitely bump this up to five stars, but at the moment can't justify it. I can confidently recommend this to anyone looking for a midrange priced headset and these are a steal if you can find them on sale (bought them on here for $150!).

The first time I put these on, i thought the power went out.  The fan noise from my nearby computer stopped suddenly.  After realizing it was just the noise cancelation i was able to detect the sound of the fans, but i honestly did not expect such a drastic difference.  These also don't make any white noise hiss like most other active noise cancelling headphones i have tried.  In other headphones i have tried, i can easily tell if the active noise cancelling is on by a soft audible hiss.  Other than temporarily disabling the noise cancelation and hearing the background noise get louder, i can't tell if its running or just quiet in the room in these.  Sound quality is quite good, but this is fairly typical of Sony headphones.  Gave the volume control 4 stars simply because the touch controls are a bit gimmicky and i would have preferred a physical control.  esspecially on my ear where i can't see the surface to orient my touch gestures.  More than once i have tried to turn up the volume only to find the headset is sitting at an odd angle causing my swipe to skip my favorite song instead.

Bought these for remote work meetings, but I am quite disappointed. The microphone is very quiet when I am using it with my Windows 10 device and after doing some research I found that it is a common issue that has yet to be addressed. If anyone is planning on getting these for remote work and you have a Windows 10 device, learn from my mistake and DONT!
Noise cancellation isnt really great which is compensated by the good sound quality. The touch controls is confusing and doesnt work well. The connectivity however is good and the range is excellent.

They sent me the replacement immediately after I got in contact and it was more than appreciated especially during this time. The only way I keep in contact with friends and family so I can hear them if Im busy with work and from the free time that I have.

This headphone paired perfectly and effortlessly with my PC after buying the ASUS USB-BT500 adapter for Windows 10. The sound quality is outstanding (of course, it's Sony). Perfect headphone for those looking for a mid-grade professional headphone. Crisp and clear highs/mids with an extra little kick of pronounced bass. The bass is not heavy hitting unless tweaked via EQ, but just enough to come through clean and pleasing. I listened to The Power of Love by Sade for the first time in a long time and it almost brought me to tears. I went out and had to buy a Monster Cable AUX cord because the included one is very short (but it was worth the $10 along with the Bluetooth adapter for $20). There is no possible way you can charge this headset with the included cable since it is literally 6" long. I'll use my Samsung charger for my phone until I can find a better alternative so that I do not damage the headphones. The touch controls are fantastic and responsive if you can actually feel your way around perfect the first time since there is NO indicators/symbols on the headphones themselves. You can also completely turn off the headset by holding your ear over the right ear-cuff and it will resume playback after removing that hand. The ONLY reason I MUST remove a star is because for gaming I suggest you DO NOT USE BLUETOOTH FUNCTION FOR GAMING (unless you can somehow make an EQ when Bluetooth is enabled which I unfortunately do not know how to do). The Bluetooth sound quality for games is absolutely horrible, tinny, hollow and inaccurate. But with a AUX cable plugged in and an EQ set through your audio driver, GOOD GOD. Perfection. Maybe I'm just using them wrong? No clue. All I know is they are CLOSE to perfect. And for the price you CANNOT go wrong. Super light-weight, comfortable, forms to your head perfect, creates an amazing seal around your ears as it hugs them perfectly and built pretty well. If someone reads this and can tell me how to get the same audio quality results through Bluetooth function for games that I get with a cable, PLEASE HELP and find someway of contacting me to fill me in. I use a cable with the headset on and a custom EQ applied through my Realtek audio driver.
If u use wired mode with the headphones turned off, the sound quality is a lot worse. Wired mode w headphones on it sounds the same but there is a hissing sound in the background very annoying

After watching numbers of videos and reading reviews decided to by WH-XB900N. There are some of the issues I have discovered after receiving these and was not happy about. None of these issues I have seen in any review, unfortunately. I would have think twice then. Here are more details: 1. I bought these to use mostly for communication (90-95% of the time) as a replacement for my current ones Logitech G533. Microphone broke after 3+ years of using these pretty much for a whole day every day. 2. Had issues connecting my new Sony headphones with PC for a first time. It worked out only after 4th attempt. Process itself is quite annoying. I had to ask Google how do do this properly and check for a new driver. 3. After first connection they reconnect without any issues. Connection time after pressing power button is about 5 seconds. That works fine for me personally. 4. Sony headphones are displayed in sound manager as 2 separate devices - headset and headphones. See snapshot. 5. Headset - to be used for communication since only in this mode microphone is active. However, when you use them with a microphone the sound quality drops down. Moreover, if you listen to your music in "headset" mode, the sound quality will be terrible. This is how I turned them on for a very first time and was VEEEERY disappointed and wanted to send them back. 6. Headphones - this mode is meant for music listening. Sound quality is nice. I'd rate it "A-". Overall - works fine for me personally. Microphone cannot be used in this mode. 7. When you listen to the music and need to make/accept a call it requires switching between between these 2 devices. This is VERY ANNOYING and not convenient!!! SONY .... come on ))) You must be kidding me. 8. Microphone sound quality - my personal feeling is "B-". As for a built-in mic it's pretty decent. Do not compare it to a standalone mic. You cannot get the same quality. 9. Noise canceling - this works great, no doubts. Definitely A+ 10. Controls - volume, play/pause, next/previous all built-in in your right ear. No buttons, just touching/swiping. 11. 3.5 mm additional cable works fine as a backup if you battery suddenly dies. Sound quality still good. Mic does not works in this mode. 12. USB C for charging - great. 13. Headphones do not work when charging. This is a disappointment. It's not complicated feature to add. My old ones G533 worked fine even when charging. Mic was functional in that mode as well. That was a huge benefit. 14. Built-in mic is a benefit for me. Less mechanical parts - less chances to break them. 15. Folding into smaller form factor is a benefit. 16. Lightweight, flexible, soft cushions, nice feeling, nice looking. 17. Cushions size - I'd prefer these to be a little larger so they would NOT touch my ears. 18. BT range - connection is not good starting at ~ 17 feet in headset mode. 19. NO APP FOR WIN 10. SETTINGS ARE NOT AVAILABLE IN THE SAME WAY AS FOR ANDROID OR IOS DEVICES!!! Summary Sound quality is great if you buy them mostly to listen to the music. I'd recommend these. If you buy these mostly for phone calls at you PC - think twice! I'd NOT recommend these. My overall rating is based on my personal experience using headphones WITH PC, WIN 10.
