Sony has always been at the forefront of audio technology performance. For more than 30 years I've been relying on them for my headphones and speakers because of the quality of sound delivery they provide. I say this because you need to understand that this review is coming from someone that appreciates what the company does well, rather than some butthurt customer looking to attack the company. These headphones provide great comfort. I have a very large head but the band still has more extension room than I require for a comfortable over-the-ear fit. They stay in place pretty well on my head. I don't know if that would be true for people with smaller heads or not, since the inward friction would be lower. The sleek design control scheme is novel. Instead of buttons on the headset, volume and action control happens from sliding a finger over the outside of the headset. Overall the design is great. However, I'm autistic and noise disturbance is a big problem for me. I ordered these headphones because I had to spend a month away from home in a place with constant disturbance and I needed the ability to control that. I ordered these specifically for the noise cancelling. The noise cancelling is almost completely non-functional. It cuts out perhaps the lowest 10% of auditory frequency and that's it. So it might cut out the hum of the fan across the room but not much else. When it comes to the sounds of conversation, music, television, etc, everything in the human communication range comes through just as loud with the noise cancelling on as with the headphones powered off. I needed noise cancelling headphones and these do not qualify. I had to turn around and order a set of Bose headphones. I'm very unhappy with the situation. I'll keep the headphones for my audio engineering work, but they get the low rating because they do not do what they are advertised for and what I counted on them for.

Got a pair of these on sale for $123 and I was blown away. I'd previously only used a pair of Skullcandy Hesh 2 headphones for a couple of years and these are much better. The quick attention feature is brilliant, the touch controls are good, the build quality is great, and the sound quality and ANC are both good as well.

A little background..  I am FAR from an audiophile both in budget I'll allow per headphones and also my critique of audio equipment but I recognize quality equipment (and poor equipment) pretty readily.  I will accept compromise when it makes sense to, etc.  I own quite a lot of headphones, but in this review I'll be doing comparisons against my top two which are my Panasonic HJE900's (in-ear buds, very neutral sound) and my AKG K545 over-ear (somewhat v shaped sound, not bassy, but not neutral like the HJE900's). My goal was to buy a do-it-all set of headphones from conference calls at the desk (bluetooth to my Linux desktop), music/entertainment at the desk, also music/calls on the phone.  I have a set of Hyper X Cloud II's that I use for conference calls at the desk and I find their sound quality quite good for what they are and the microphone is excellent but the cables are in the way all the time and it'd be nice to replace my use of the AKG's and the Cloud II's into a single device.  I don't quite think I'm there, but I'm still pretty happy.  I will update when I'm doing conference calls again after a break but I think things will be fine.  Onto the review. Pluses AAC, AptX, AptX HD, and LDAC will keep these headphones relevant for a long time.  I was always reluctant to buy any expensive bluetooth headphones because they would be out of date with old codecs as a2dp codecs improve over time, but these are good enough to not be concerned about what's coming.  I suspect in the future we'll see perhaps more efficient codecs, ones that are more resistant to drop-outs, maybe a headset profile that doesn't sound terrible, but these are just fine.  Seriously, why are bluetooth headset profiles still the same super-low bitrate defined 20 years ago for the very first bluetooth headsets? Bluetooth range is amazing, all my other headsets will cut out here and there in my (small) house but have never heard a single drop-out on this one, using LDAC.  Have not tested a range of "can walk N feet from my phone" but real world use it keeps up great.  Even out in the yard it drops out a time or two, which I suspect would be fine if I had my bluetooth dongle up higher.  It's currently plugged into a hub under my monitor. They are comfortable enough, but my ears are fairly big and my right ear feels like it's touching inside.  It's not enough to be uncomfortable but enough to notice.  So doesn't bother me, or hurt, or make me want to take them off..  but I do notice it sometimes. I am no audiophile, but I appreciate quality headphones.  I don't have any expensive ones, but I do have Panasonic HJE900 and AKG K545 as my best in-ear and best over-ear.  The HJE900's are very precise and and have a very flat sound profile, the K545's are pretty good with more of a V profile but far from a "bassy" headset.  The Sony 900N's, but being "extra bass" surprised me at first that they weren't as boomy as I was fearing they would be.  However I did fairly quickly drop them 2-3db across the bottom EQ ranges as certain tracks which I assume had more bass in them naturally got pretty boomy sounding.  Like Tommy from The Who is a very boomy album and these headphones hit pretty hard the whole time; I do have to EQ "more" on albums like this.  So overall I find them not obscenely bassy on most music, but some tracks/albums it's pretty overpowering.  So are these great headphones who want a really flat profile?  No.  Are they so boomy they aren't good for everyone else?  No to that as well; they're fine.  If EQ'ed, however.  If you can't EQ your music in some way these might be too overpowering if you don't like the bass. Besides that, I find the mid and high frequency reproduction to be fine, not as good as the HJE900's, almost as good as the K545's.  Soundstage is more cramped than both, however.  My K545's are closed back which seems like the two would be similar, but the 900N's are less wide a sound stage.  Channel-dynamic tracks like Pink Floyd etc are well separated, they sound fine but they do not have an open feel to them.  Something like the K545's the channels feel like they're originating a foot out from my ears, while the 900N's feel like it's a few inches. A lot of reviews on youtube comment obsessively over the "feel" of the plastic on the 900N's...  It's fine.  They are clearly thick and sturdy plastics and the feel of the plastic fine.  It's just different than the 1000N's seems to be the comparison.  I do not have 1000N's to compare, however. I've worn the headphones two days in a row a few times, no battery concerns, at all.  They don't charge super fast but I don't care; at the end of the second day the battery was "about 50%" so I plugged them in.  As for the battery info; I've heard it's very limited in what the battery levels will report which is a shame.  I suspect Sony was afraid they couldn't give exact numbers so they reduced the granularity, but I prefer to recharge batteries before they drop below 25% or so and it would be nice to at least have 10% battery granularity. The ambient modes are pretty handy.  I've only used them in the house to talk to the wife but it feels like it'd be great for users who work in an office and need to hear their surroundings for a moment or all the time, but other times need to block out the world.  Touching the right cup is a very quick way to emable ambient mode and I've left the Custom button toggling between the ambient and noise-cancelling modes. I've never owned any noise cancelling headphones as the ones I've heard in the past distorted everything, including the music, and still let in a bunch of ambient sound in.  No idea what I had tested in the past, but these are a very different beast.  My computer fans completely disappear.  Road noise in the car completely disappears.  I have not been on a train, plane, etc, but I imagine they'd be great there too.  And if you need to hear what's going on around you, Sony offers 20 levels of ambient noises.  Honestly not sure that 20 is very useful, but it's there if you need it.  You can only flip between Noise Cancelling on, Noise Cancelling + Ambient Sound Mode, or Ambient Sound Mode off.  The first two cut out most low noises but allow voices etc in, and can be adjusted in the app to what level of noises it allows in.  The third mode turns off all Noise Cancelling altogether.  The headphones have pretty good noise isolation of their own, as would be expected for them to be able to block noise. I have not nor really intend to use them with a 3.5mm plug, but it is there if you need it.  My understanding is they are usable with the 3.5mm plug with the headset off, but of course no Noise Cancelling and I've seen a few things say the audio quality isn't as good as with the headset off there's no preamp on in the headset. But they work in a pinch.  I imagine you could charge them while you use them on 3.5mm, but you can not use them on Bluetooth and charge at the same time. If you want a good set of headphones for silence; ie:  purely blocking noise, no music, etc, I can't really speak to that either.  I would think that a good set of isolating headphones would do that job better but not sure. Minor nits/picks The touch is a bit over sensitive sometimes, just moving the headphones or getting hair out of my way I sometimes skip tracks by accident. Since these are noise blocking and attach solidly to your head, you do need to put them on and take them off fairly slowly.  They will actually push/pull on your eardrum a little.  I can feel it just a tad when I take them off, but it's not uncomfortable. Disappointments Can't connect between Phone and Desktop at the same time, at all.  My Fiio BTR3 will stay connected to my desktop playing music and stay connected to my phone and play music from it if I pause the desktop.  It will auto switch between the two without me doing anything which is great.  It will also take over for phone calls so even if I'm listening to music on the desktop and I get a phone call the phone will take priority.  I have to manually disconnect for the 900N's to connect to either.  You can pair up to 10 devices, so it's not a huge deal, but having to manually disconnect from one, manually connect to another..  Is a bit annoying.  It will always connect to the last device it was connected to by default like most bluetooth devices do. I have yet to get the Google Assistant to do anything except tell me the time.  I press and hold the button and say something and it says "Sorry".  Not sure what I am doing wrong here, but I've given up on it and reassigned the button back to ambient sound control.  It's also a real shame that Sony couldn't figure out a way to allow the user to control both functions.  It's either Ambient Sound control, or Assistant controls.  Another button or some other gesture on the right ear perhaps would have worked.

I bought the xb950bt before these (i think i got that tag right) and those headphones were great. I had not yet had a high quality headset like those, only cheap apple earbuds before, and I remember those blowing me away with the sound quality and the bass. When those inevitably wore out after I think two years, I looked right back to this line of headphones, and found these. After ordering them I immediately found the noise canceling and the better shape very good additions, the noise canceling makes for a far more immersive experience when listening to nearly anything. The bluetooth connection has been very intuitive and unfailing, occasionally when I pair to a new device (this includes using the pair function to connect to previously paired devices) the volume will be much lower than the volume level indicator tells me, but a quick off/on fixes that. The shape around the ears is tight, and if the headphones are tilted too far back or forward it can irritate the ears after a while, but they do not drift and I almost always put them on at the right tilt without thinking about it. Now, I have a pretty big head, I've always had to stretch sunglasses and sports helmets and such. These headphones do get a little uncomfortable for me after about an hour of use, so if you know that you have a pretty big head then I would suggest you take that into account, and if you're not sure then you probably don't have to worry about it. TL;DR: Great headphones, not a waste of money, good noise canceling, great bass, they do get uncomfortable after a while for people with big heads, but other than that I have really nothing to critique about these.

These are good headphones for the price. Noise cancelling isn't 100% I can still hear some noise but it's not a dealbreaker for me.  Controls can be a bit tricky, but they just take some getting use to.  Also minor thing, but like with most headphones glass wearers will feel some slight irritation. Aside from these minor issues I find them stylish and functional.

I was really excited to get this after reading a great number of reviews online. I had been eyeing these for a while but hesitated during the prime sale last year thinking that prices would go lower during black friday but I was wrong. So I waited till' Christmas sale and I was really happy when it went on sale again. I have been a loyal Sony user for a long time when it comes to audio products. I used the Walkman as a kid and 90% of the earphones/headphones I purchased in my life came from Sony. Hence, I was looking forward to another solid purchase but this is a BIG time disappointment from Sony. Bought this over Christmas sale and have been using it for ~3 months now. Pros: > The sound quality is OK. > Wireless bluetooth has a decent range and works well. > Battery life is decent. Cons: > The sound quality is underwhelming for the price you are paying. > There is a "microphone" in a sense that it's there but it doesn't actually work for realistic usage. Every video conference I have attended using this pair of headphones begins with everyone in the call complaining that the audio from my end is muffled, too soft or inaudible. More often, people can't hear you at all. > The build quality is extremely cheap and plasticy. The joints creak with the lightest touch and swivel. Especially when you click the buttons. The XB-650BT back then was miles ahead in terms of quality. > The charge time is too long but I understand that this might be more of a limitation on battery tech. > The headphones don't remember your Sony Connect equalizer settings when you switch devices but this might just be my setup (iPhone + PC). > The headphones default to Noise cancelling every time you turn them on. It's annoying if you use the ambient sound setting or if you don't want either of the noise cancelling or ambient sound effects as you have to toggle them every time you turn the device on. > The product includes a wired option but there it doesn't relay signals from the mic on your headphones. I guess that doesn't matter anyway since the mic doesn't work. I am really disappointed with this purchase. Definitely look elsewhere if you are looking for wireless headphones.

Fantastic sound quality!!! I am not crazy about the "swipe" volume control.  I prefer a dial. These are completely Blutooth headphones, which we purchased in order to be compatible with the new LG OLED TV we bought -- WHICH HAS ONLY ONE "SOUND OUT" OUTPUT -- BIG MISTAKE (but that's for another review.) Because it is Blutooth, the range of the headphones is very limited, but certainly sufficient if you are using them in the same room with the source.
Husband bought it discounted due to minor scratch. The damage was so minor we couldn't find it. It sounds, looks, and works great. Husband uses them to play Call of Duty.

These are a fantastic set of headphones. They check all the boxes. Incredibly comfortable and light weight, they just float on your head. Large openings for the earcups and very plush materials and padding are a huge plus. Great soundstage all around, highs, mids & lows. Super punchy bass, especially with the app but they can go pretty neutral when corded. So versatile. Smart touch controls for volume, tracks, pause/play and the quick mute on the earcup are nice touches of added tech. These are really optimized for mobile devices in terms of sound and features. I don't use the noise canceling feature often so I cant really rate it or compare it to others. The only drawbacks are the boring style/design made with mostly matte plastic. It does benefit by keeping the weight low however.

headphone.review: First day an I love these. The plastic feels a bit cheap and the headphones are very light  it they are incredibly comfortable and they sound amazing. From the start the basis a big much but that's easily fixed by an in app eq. The headphones are very easy to use in my opinion and feel like a modern step up with the touch pad on the right side and minimal amount of buttons which had a total of two. All song control is done by right side from skipping songs, up and down of volume and pause and skip. I'll update as I continue to play with them.

After being off for about 12 hours usually after being turned on it turns off despite having more than 50% battery. It also seems to lack adequate amount of microphones to pick up ambient noise and their position results in a very narrow range so that if you turn your head noise becomes audible again. The adaptive noise cancelling since to do the opposite of what the name would imply, it actually let in noise depending on your environment at different amounts instead of increasing the amount of noise reduction. The overall noise reduction isn't anything special, but it's mostly only noticeable when you have something on the headphones. without music or audio playing only the low-frequency low-volume noises are canceled out and that difference based on where your head is positioned or turned.

Great headphones, at first I put them on and was like uhhh these aren't that clear.  After downloading the Sony App and messing with the equalizer, I can say the sound is as good as the Bose QC35 II but these have BASS added which was much much needed.  I am selling my Bose now and keeping the Sonys :)
If you own the mdr-xb950n1, do not replace them with these.  The bass isn't as strong and the noise canceling isn't as good.  The plus is they fit better and the microphone works better.

These Headphones have a Great Amount of Bass, and I'm A Bass-Head!. The Sound Quality is Pretty Soild Overall. The Battery Life is Really Good! My Dislike about the Headphones is when you have it Paused for about 10 min it will cut off automatically without notice. Can't Wait for the Updated Version But Until Then, these My Favorite Headphones

Review update after a couple of weeks: my ears started hurting. I never had that problem with my old Bose headphones. I assume it is due to the bip sound I get each time I turn up/down the volume, Star/end playing , or skip/repeat a song. I called Sony customer service to help me lower or turn off that bip and they said it is not possible. Also, sometimes I try to pair with a device I paired before, i have to remove it and add it again to the Bluetooth devices to pair to. This last issue seems to be a malfunctioning problem, don't know if other people have experienced that.  Despite the great sound, nice color and design, I will have to return it. Can't take it anymore. :-( First review: Love these headphones! Great sound, comfortable ear cushions, and love the blue color on them. The only thing is that I wish they would open facing the ear cushions, not the back, but this is a minor detail and up to one's preference. :-)

I bought these to replace the Bose QC headphones. I had my Bose headphones paired to three devices, my phone, desktop computer, and laptop. Now it remembered all those connections and I would be able to hit a switch on the earcup to select which one I would want to listen to. That was a really convenient feature that I use all the time. The problem is that the Sony couldn't do that. That was a dealbreaker for me so I returned them. Here are a few examples of why device switching was important. Sometimes I would be coming home while listening to Spotify on my phone and Bose. Now when I got home, I would want to use my PC so I'd just switch audio inputs and now I could listen to YouTube videos or whatever. Then later when I'd go to school, I'd take my laptop out to study and I would just switch my Bose to listen to that. It was a really good feature to have and I wish Sony would implement that.
These headphones give you more than just sound it give a variety of sound and acoustical experiences.

These are absolutely fantastic. I hardly ever write reviews but felt this was necessary. I had an old pair of non-nopise canceling sonys from like 2012 so I needed an upgrade. Tried beats studio 3 and they absolutely sucked. Saw a flash deal on these for like $125 and jumped on it. Build quality is iffy but if you're wanting to use them for studying or planes, etc it should be fine. Sound is great and so is noise cancelation.

Headphones are great in sound quality, the noise cancelation is excellent, there is many options in the Sony app for customization. However, for headphones that advertise "Extra Bass" its quite unnoticeable. At least when compared to there predecessors with the Extra Bass button or even the Crushers. Even a 30$ pair of Bludio headphones have more bass to them. Disappointed.

I got these to replace my old apple ear buds, which just recently deteriorated after 4 years of solid use. I was so excited to invest in my first real pair of headphones! But then I got them and put them on and immediately had concerns. Even compared to using my old apple ear buds for years, these headphones are *terrible.* Some immediate problems I had with these: (1) Noise cancelling: If the volume is above 4, others can hear the music, but if the volume is below 4, I can hear others. Noise cancelling? Nope. These headphones are completely useless for studying around other people. (2) Static and sound quality: the pair I got could very well be defective for the amount of static that I hear when I play *classical music at low bass and low volume sitting down with my phone in my pocket.* I've had a pair of $20 sport bluetooth earphones from Mpow that don't create as much static as these things do. It hurts my ears after a while and it completely demolishes the sound quality. I would rather sit with them turned off to try to mask the sound of people moving and talking around me than deal with the static they produce. (3) Random bell ringing: in the middle of a song, the music will cut out, a bell will ring, and then my music resumes. It is incredibly annoying and I don't know why its happening. The headphones are fully charged. I am not receiving any notifications. I'm not making any changes or pressing any buttons on my phone and it happens both when I'm stationary and moving. (4) Bass: sure, its fine. But when the rest of the headphone is completely unusable why would I be impressed? tl;dr: I'm so disappointed.

The first pair of headphones I bought off of amazon were either an old model or defective. I say this because the bass was muddy and the vocals were muffled. The quick attention barely worked and the earcups were way too thick and the right earcups made a weird squealing puff of air noise when I put them on. They felt heavy too. I return them and got a model from Best Buy waaaay better in terms of comfort and overall sound quality. Bass was clearer and you could actually hear other instruments. I don't recommend getting these off if Amazon unless your forced too. And no I'm not promoting Best buy this is based off my personal experience.

As a seasoned musician with years of studio experience I feel that I can offer some good input.  These headphones have very good low freq bass that seems to be lacking in the higher end Bose headsets, but they do not even come close to the level of active noise canceling that you get with Bose!  If Im going to be traveling/flying Bose all day, if Im home and dont need noise cancelling I use the Sony for the awesome bass response.  Great sounding headphones with serious bass but not in the same league as Bose for noise cancelling.

As a student, I loved Sony WH-XB900N. It is quite a bit heavy but it is worth it. It has really good sound cancellation and sound quality. If you are between sony wh-1000xm3 and this headphone. Personally I would prefer sony wh-1000xm3. HOWEVER, you are looking for a lower price and the same quality, this is the headphone you should buy.  WH-XB900N and wh-1000xm3 have the same specs. Only difference is wh-1000xm3 is just a more premium version of WH-XB900N. If you are looking for a fitness headphone, this is the wrong one because you should have something light and comfortable when you are active. But you are searching for a headphone for every usage, WH-XB900N will work. Sony did an excellent job by creating a amazing software and hardware in this headphone and also its app. If you have any sony headphone, you should definitely get sony's app to use your headphone's full capacity.

First, let me put my review in context.  I have 5 pairs of headphones at all price points from 100 to $1000, including such names as Bose and Fostex.  I considered these headphones because of reviews.  I had tried the Sony M3 and they were awful at Best Buy.  So I ordered these thinking I would send them back...and I didn't.  They are a keeper for me and here is why. If you try these headphones at Best Buy, you will be disappointed.  The sound is flat, dull and not detailed.  BUT, if you buy them and play them wirelessly thru the Sony app, the experience is entirely different.  There are almost endless adjustments you can do, and I am sure most people will find a setting or make a custom setting to their liking.  At that point you will have a very comfortable, headphone with a great sound experience.  Plug them directly into a source and you will lose the app control and find yourself disappointed.  These headphones are meant to be wireless for best results.  The bass is great, and the mids are very good.  The detail in the highs is ok.  You are probably wondering how these compare to the others I have.  They are now my favorite wireless headphone.  The only one that beats these are not wireless and cost 4X as much.

These headphones feel nice, sounds amazing, and the Amazon exclusive blue looks so so good. These headphones do a fantastic job of noise cancelling but they don't do the best they could possibly do. See these are like a pared down 1000XM3s where the trim is not quite as nice and the noise cancelling is intentionally worse. What I mean by worse is that whatever these can do with NC, the XM3s can do about 20% better. But at $100 less that is nothing to complain about because these are still much better headphones than anything else in the same price range. And I can't hear anything in my surroundings. However if you plan to buy these these one thing you need to know. They do not do well in windy environments. They pick up ALL the wind through the mics and you can hear it a lot.

I previously bought my girl friend the Sony xm2 and am comparing them.  I also have a pair of the Sony 700 series Noise cancellation felt closer to the 700 series.  Not as good as the xm series. The features from a swipe/cupping the right headphone to change volume, tracks, cancel noise canceling were on par with the xm2 Material quality is very cheap on the xb900n compared to the others. If on sale, worth some thought.  If not, wait for the xm series to go on sale

Very clear audio. I've never enjoyed bass (and the other ranges) as much as I have with these. Often the dynamic range of audio systems reduces the clarity of what I hear but these headphones present a clear, broad range i really like.

WOW!  The ultimate headphones I have ever tried. And I have gone thru about 15 of them.  So good Im buying. Few more for family members. You start with the advanced Sony system to measure and ensure your headset is tuned for you.

I got $100 off on the Amazon daily deal around black friday, I paid $150 for them. The noise canceling is average, meaning that it blocks out ambience but not loud people. The sound quality and eq that goes with the app is cool. Very bassy. The eq app is not downloadable for Windows and does not appear on the windows app store. The touch buttons suck and it feels like I have to smack it to make it work, But for getting $100 off these headphones it was worth it. I wouldn't have paid for them if they were $199 or more

These headphones offer alot of Sony's best features for less. I got mine on sale for $150 bucks and I would say it's the perfect price for them. I went in and tested headphones in the store beforehand and these were actually the most comfortable. More than the M3s. Sound quality is surprisingly comparable as well. Though if you have the money and the M3s do feel better in the hand. However, these were comparable enough that I found saving the money worth it.

I wanted to like these as I've had other Sony headphones that were well made. These ones fifth wheel and have nice fit and finish, but they do not cancel exterior noise and well they paired readily to my Samsung cell phone, when I paired them with my Samsung tablet I couldn't get enough volume to hear them. They just flat don't work well. What a disappointment!

Great sound and I love the eq and other functions in the app could be better on noise cancelation but is not too bad. The one star deduction is for shaky touch volume control on the right ear cup and not the best noise cancelation. Just an FYI I have tested 5 or 6 different sets of headphones and this is definitely a product that you get what you pay for if you have the budget, spend a little more and ignore the low-end range headphones.

I love these headphones. Got them during Cyber Monday, so I got them for a good deal. The sound in them is great and in my opinion is comparable to Dolby quality. I have yet to hear a problem with the audio on them. The battery life on these is AWESOME! I can use them for 1-4 hours and just use AT MOST 20-30% of the battery, with semi-heavy use. Also, unlike some Bluetooth headphones, these can be used over a good distance without having to move your phone or other device that it is connected to. Also, it has Google and Alexa compatibility, so you can use them when you have your phone on you (which is nice). My only problems with these are as follows: 1. I don't like the touch controls. There is no other way, besides using Alexa or Google, to change the volume or skip a song. I have also found the touch controls to be a little inconsistent when you try and use them. Maybe I'm using them wrong, but it just doesn't feel natural. 2. I have found that sometimes the noise cancellation isn't the best and cuts in and out in certain environments. Overall, great headphones! These are awesome headphones and I'd recommend them to anyone who wants to get a good pair of Bluetooth headphones with smart assistant capability an great sound.

I love this pair of headphones - thank you Sony. Controls are easy to access, very comfortable and stylish. Just not as seamless as the airpods when using on iOS/OSx, but noise cancelation works well when the volume is turned up.

This definitely is a good upgrade from the previous Sony Headphones like MDR-100ABNBN.  It is light and comfortable.  Good Bass but I didn't find any change in the Noise Cancelling. I feel it is the same as the previous models.  Only Bass is better.  That's why only 4 stars.

Awesome headphones!!!! They are great for traveling, studying, and working out. Multiple uses for music and audiobooks/podcasts. Multiple premium features through the Sony app. I would highly recommend buying these. Definitely worth the money!!!!!!

I really like these headphones. They sound amazing with, obviously, heavy bass. These SHAKE on full volume. I wouldn't recommend downloading the sony app since it askes for location and pictures of you to be used as intended. They're very comfortable, light, foldable, and have thick earcups that prevent any soundleak. Noise-cancelling is also great. Having it on with any audio at half volume blocks out basically everything. The only think i don't like is the touch controls. In theory, it would be very convienent and functional. While it works, it is extremely sensitive, making it impossible to use while wearing a wide hoodie. Also, they aren't waterproof, so be careful when taking them out in the rain. Overall, i'd give it a 4.5. Definitly a top tier pick for headphones under $300. Love these so far.

These are really great sounding headphones overall. Has decent sound cancellation, some sounds manage to bleed through here and there. It's great that there is an app where one can adjust it to their liking. The only thing (maybe it's just me/my head) is that they got really uncomfortable where they started hurting my ears. I will be returning these unfortunately for this reason. I don't see the point in one suffering when wanting to listen to something on these headphones. Maybe it's just the tightness around the head or the cushions?

Watch a good war movie with these headphones such as Saving Private Ryan, Midway, or Dunkirk and the sound is as you are in an Imax theater.  Pairing with the bluetooth receiver for the TV was a pain but worth it.

I have no complaints about the sound or noise cancellation; they both function satisfactorily. However, the headphones can only connect to a single device at once; in fact, if they're connected to a laptop and you try to connect with your phone, it won't play audio through the headphones even if it shows as connected. Instead, you need to manually disconnect from your laptop first. This is unacceptably clumsy in such a product, especially when far lower-priced competitors handle this without an issue.

The headphones are nice. The quality is overall done well. The pairing is easy (took 5 seconds right out of the package). The app allows a lot of volume adjustments and equalizer settings, even some volume spacial adjustments. Comfort is 5/5. The only part part of these headphones that I dont like is the noise cancelling. It should honestly be called noise reduction as the word cancelling is false advertisement. I can easily hear everything around me but reduced to roughly 40% of the volume This may be because people experience dizziness/nausea with true cancelling. But I bought this to work from home and cancel out all of the noise around me. If I blast music then I cant hear anything but that goes for any headphones. Very disappointed because the cancelling is the main reason for my purchase. I would recommend this to people for great sounds + base and mild reduction to sound. For anyone else looking for a pleasant way to eliminate noise around you, I would go somewhere else.
Headphone is nicely build but the bass is too much and i have to control it through software.

I wanted to love these phones.  Very good sound quality, noise cancellation and build quality, but when putting them on, the over-ear seal is so air-tight that my ears felt a strong pressure while the cups made the seal.  Then when removing the phones, again, significant air pressure outward causing strong ear pressure.  Then I read the warning shown in my photo.  I'm used to reading warnings about hearing loss as a result of stupid volume levels, but never a warning like this:  "Because the headphones achieve a tight seal over the ears, forcibly pressing them against your ears or quickly pulling them off can result in eardrum damage."  Returned them.

I have had Sony headphones in the past, and when it became time to replace my last headphones (not Sony) I looked at all of the different headphones and decided on the Sony headphones.  When they arrived, the directions amounted to pictures with no written description.  I was able to sync the headphones to my television and they worked okay, except I couldn't adjust the sound up or down.  I tried to follow the direction to hook up my cell phone, but it wouldn't work.  I tried to work with my Alexa, still no connection.  Today my Blue tooth connection to my television failed.  I tried to get it to sync up with no success. I tried to find out if there was something I was missing and called the customer service line at Sony.  I was cut off the first two times and then when I did finally get through, I was given a recording that said because of the Covid epidemic and I should go on line to get my answers.  After attempting to read some ridiculously small print, I gave up.  I will be returning these and looking for some headphones that have a company that has real customer service.  Sony has lost a long time customer and I won't be buying anything with their brand again.

These headphones are great and do a decent job of noise canceling your surrounding, but this is done digitally rather than the click of an actual button like the higher end model or boses. They fit great if you have big ears, but head does run warm with the way the ear pieces cover the ears and material it is made from. You won't get ear fatigue on these headphones, but you may sweat a bit. The bass is a def welcome to sounds but you want might want to adjust in the app. I will warn the user the these head phones are semi- cheaply made for where the headphones attach to the rails. Be very careful when using these headphones if you don't buy an accidental or all coverage type of warranty. As the base coverage warranty covers nothing at all unless you can prove beyond a reasonable doubt that this is a true defect. Customer service does nothing to help you and your out of luck of these $200+ head phones.

We had the Sony-XB950B1 headphones and they were so comfortable and the quality great - but they broke too easily (as others have found)- so thought I would get these instead. I don't find them very comfortable for long wearing and the swiping up and down for volume (while useful) is a bit hit and miss. Not thrilled given the cost.

The sound quality is great but two months into owning the headphones and they're already broken. I extended them to the max and one day one side popped right off and the next day, the other. The warranty doesn't cover "physical damage".  My ears often rub against the inside of the earphones as well, to the point they get tender and hurt quite a bit. Update: The headphones have broken somewhere else just from me taking the headphones off with one hand. Terrible build quality

I have had this headphones for about 9 months and today I notice an issue with one side of the headband that is missing a plastic piece that blocks the headband from coming loose from the ear speaker. Talked with Sony and also with Amazon to check warranty for this issue and non can do anything, Amazon relies on Sony and Sony considers this as an accidental damage which clearly was not caused by more than normal usage. Other brands with cheaper headphones and good features have better warranty than this, if you want to buy something with built quality I suggest you look for another brand that has better warranty policy and responsibility with the user. Will not buy again Sony Headphones because its a risk if they do not really handle a better warranty.

I bought this headphone while Amazon was doing a flash sale at 40% discount off of the price it is a few days later. This headphone performed so much worse than Bose 700 that I took it off after just under 30 seconds. Everything is much worse! (And it couldnt connect to my iPad Pro) And honestly, my last day-use Bluetooth noise canceling headphone was a Chinese headphone under gorilla marketing at Amazon was better. (Gorilla marketing as in the shop and brand disappears after a few months and you can never find the product, maker or seller again) that $70 No-name Chinese headphone had better noise cancelation and bass than this thing. That headphone was 3 years older, less than half the discounted price and still outperformed. I think my expectation was set too high for a Sony product, I apologize if this is too strongly worded: dont buy it, not even at discount, not worth the time. On the plus side, the headphone is definitely more portable than the Bose 700 and my Chinese gorilla headphone. The earpiece can both spin and fold. The material feels more forgiving to daily use than those other two. Good luck to you if you buy it.

Love the touch controls. very nice headphones for a layman (me). but sound quality started to degrade after about 12 months of use 5 days a week 6 hours day. Pops, crackles and a buzz started to overtake anything I was listening to.  For the price I wish they would have lasted longer.

My daily driver.  Noise cancellation is honestly an afterthought with these cans.  They block out SOME noise but they're nowhere near the level of noise cancellation from the WH-1000XM3's.  Like, I appreciate that there's SOME noise cancellation here but it's not why I bought these headphones.  It's the sound. PUNCHY bass but not overwhelming.  Just the right amount of BOOM.  USB-C charging is so much appreciated! I really can't wait until micro USB finally dies on headphones and pretty much everything else.  USB-C needs to proliferate more quickly across the tech world. Anyway, sound is great.  Bass is great.  Battery life is awesome.  They claim 30 hours but I never tested to see exactly how long.  I just know they last me for hours and hours.  Call quality is also pretty good.  People on the other end never had issues clearly hearing me.  Touch controllers work well, too.  No problems there. Easy buy!

I needed to replace my Apple earpods and I wanted something over-the-ear. I found these headphones and they are absolutely wonderful! I can connect them to multiple devices and switch between devices as I may need them. They are a game changer!

As a hip hop fan I've been using V Moda products for almost 10 years and those are my primary point of comparison. These are also my first over ear bluetooth headphones. As expected from an XB product the bass is fantastic for my uses. I will say that the sound quality is probably slightly worse than the crossfade LP2s I was coming from but I was sick of my VModa products falling apart after 5 years. That being said the build quality seems great, the Bluetooth has the absolute slightest lag for shows/movies but even someone case picky as me couldn't tell beyond the first second or two. The one thing that was disappointing is that I intended to use these headphones plugged in to my computer most of the time and if you do not have them turned on, the sound quality is garbage. Once I put a dedicated charger at my desk for nightly charging, it no longer was an issue since it always had enough charge for the day. I believe they are rated at 30 hours from a single charge.

The ultimate bass head audiophile headphone. If you want hard hitting and impactful bass without sacrificing quality in the other levels then this is the headphone for you. I own also own the XM3s, which are a great headphone for every genre, but when I want to listen to hip hop these are the headphones I grab. Dont buy these for the noise canceling because they are not comparable to the XM3s, they are good but not at that level. The app also allows you to change the audio signature to your preference and save different settings.

Apparently, wireless headphones are always subpar when taking calls. And if you use a cable, guess what, you cant use headphones mic over cable. The sound is fat, is exaggerated lows. The plastic is rough. For what they deliver, headphones feel rugged, rough, and very unsophisticated. Would be great if you want to save a buck cause you are working at a woodshop or something. Can not recommend it. Cheapo no-name headphones would do the job just as good.
I Love these headphones
Is a comfortable headphones to wear..

These headphones I bought for my wife and after hearing them bought a pair for myself. In wireless mode they work for hours on end. Making an international flight possible on a full charge, even with noise cancellation on. The noise cancellation works great I was really surprised how loud the aircraft was when I took them off and this is from a season flyer as I pre-COVID would fly at least 4 -6 times a month on various jets large and small. There is ample volume that I use it while cutting my lawn with a riding mower. The peacefulness is astounding LOL. great Product good price you need to have one :)

Comfortable and the sound is great. Giving them two stars because the Bluetooth connection is terrible. I bought one pair and returned them as defective because the Bluetooth was constantly cutting out. I received a replacement set and have the same issue. I own multiple different brands of Bluetooth headphones and have never had an issue carrying my phone in my pocket while listening to music with an uninterrupted connection. These headphones cut out constantly.

The headphones fit nice. I didn't really want the blue tooth as my  PC doesn't support blue tooth. Using the headphone jack I didn't care for the sound quality for the price of the item. perhaps some people would prefer the heavy bass sound as I much prefer the balance of bass and high end. Not sure if having blue tooth would have made a difference but the product description didn't elaborate on sound quality other than the bass sound.

I am a huge fan of my AirPods, but I was looking for something with better sound quality and noise cancelation. These headphones are over priced for the flaws they have. The connectibility toggling between devices is clunky, the noise cancelation isnt great, sometimes there is a low hum/buzz for no reason, the power on/connected voice is jarring, and they are pretty bulky on my head. The sound quality once you get everything going is pretty good, and the battery life is excellent. I just wish the other kinks had been worked out :/ #wouldreturnifIcould

The noise cancelling is terrible on this headphone. Overall the headphone feels cheap and not worth the money. I have both the older Sony WH-1000XM3 and the new Sony WH-1000XM4 headphones and they are great. I understand that these headphones are more expensive but they are both excellent. My advice to a  headphone buyer is to  save your  money for a XM4 headphone or buy a different cheap headphone from a brand like Taotronics or Anker or ?. I actually gave the 900N headphone to a friend's child for free as a first headphone.

I loved using these headphones and treated them as gently, but the left ear completely gave out after about 5 months. Never dropped it or bumped it, just put it down on my desk and when I picked it up again it wasnt working. Considering I treated them like a newborn, it certainly makes me question the manufacture, and wouldnt recommend them to someone who is more on the go or looking for a long-term headphone.

These headphones are supposed to work with the Sony Headphones Connect app - REALLY? Guess what? I installed the app and it just crashes after it asks me to connect to Bluetooth. Very annoying. I love Sony TVs but these headphones are a headache!!! I am returning them!

I do not recommend buying these if you want to use them for their mic on Windows 10. Mic audio has a muffled and low max volume when used on Windows 10 systems. With an android smartphone, I found no issues with the mic. It appears there is an interoperability issue just with Windows 10. After doing a little review checking on Sony's website, I did not find any enheartening signs that they will issue a firmware update to fix this. Everything else was fine. Switching between ANC, Ambient Sound, and AS off was really nice since a voice over told you when you were in which mode. The Sony phone app was useful. The touch controls were also really nice. Palming the right cups cut the volume and let in outside sounds to have conversations with those around me. It's a shame that the mic did not work as advertised. But I suppose that is why it was discounted so heavily during sales season this year and why I bought it. I have already returned it and am considering just spending more on a high-tier ANC headphone set since entry-mid tier sets do not appear to get enough design attention from their manufacturers to have the pleasant day-to-day usability I want. Cheers, Elliot

These headphones are pretty awesome. I love the bass on them. The noise-cancellation is very impressive. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. USB-C is a great added benefit. Only downside is the touch panel isnt super responsive and the app is a bit confusing. Otherwise, its great! :D

Wow the XB really does stand for xtra bass! I love my music bass heavy. I like to feel the music and this delivers. I can max out the volume with no distortion at all. The app pairs well with the headphones. The custom equalizer is awesome. Noise cancellation is ok for the price (123.00) no complaints there.

I have a pair of cheap-o Harbor Freight noise cancelling headphones that are total garbage, yet still do a better job at noise cancellation.  I think Sony has just said "noise cancelling" just because you have something over your ears, and does nothing to actually actively, computer controlled cancel out noise.  100% will be returning this garbage.

My first bluetooth over-ear headphones was the Skullcandy Hesh 3if you wanted to switch paired devices, you had power down the headphones, power them back on into pairing mode, then select them on the phone or computer. It's tedious but I thought this was the only way. Next pair was the Sennheiser HD 4.40bt, and to my pleasant surprise, you don't have to power them down or enter pairing mode at all! If you're connected to the phone, then want to switch to the computer, you simply select it on the device, and PRESTOit's connected. SO EASY, SO SIMPLE! I just bought the Sony WH-XB900N, and was fully expecting this switching behavior to be standardIT IS NOT. You have to do the same, unbelievably tedious operation like the Hesh 3s, turn them off, turn it back on, enter pairing mode, then connect. NO THANK YOU! Everything else is great, noise cancelling, audio quality, comfort, but this is a huge deal for me, since I like to switch devices many times during the day. What should take 3 seconds turns into a 30 second operation. Returned.

This is purely a waste of money. The volume is so low my $59.00 sound core headphones by Anker with its flaws is way better than these headphones by SONY. I got it on sale for $130.00 and sent them back. I still havent found headphones that have the quality of my Beats Proffessional plug-in studio headphones Ive had since 2018 that cost me $300.00. Ive just ordered JBLs, lets see how this goes.

I am really impressed with these headphones. Reading other comments left me doubtful. The big thing for me is having good bass. It took some searching on computer, but if you get the sound control set up right with enhancements, these things are really good.

I like the fit on these headphones and the sound is above average but the on off button and the other controls suck. If you barely touch the sides of the headphones they trigger the various controls but if you try to do it on purpose it never seems to work properly.

Could not get these to work with a Windows 10 laptop. Sony has apps for phones, but not for laptops. Headphones seemed to pair with laptop using blue-tooth, but did not show up in the listing of audio output devices. Amazon technical support could not help besides suggesting I try using them with my phone. My goal was to use these headphones to watch movies on my laptop.
These headphones are the right price for good quality noise cancellation and sound quality.
My 13 yo loves these headphones. The over ear coverage is a little tight for him and has been his only slight complaint.

I like these pretty much they sound really good but they have a few issues the invisible volume control buttons are stupid they're kind of cool for about two minutes and then they are irritating as hell would much rather have a dial or hard buttons the voice comes on says to recharge your headphones when you still have about 50% battery life left I guess they're trying to get you to ruin the battery so you'll have to buy another pair luckily I'm not that stupid you charge it with 50% battery power left you're going to lose the 50% which I guess is the whole point

Bought this for my girlfriend and she loves it but it's her first pair of noise cancelling over the ear headphones. I own more premium noise cancelling headphones (brand rhymes with "hose") and this sony mid tier headphone set doesn't sit right with me. Go for the big dog if you have the cash, whichever brand you prefer but just go for the top of the line model.

There is nothing that I dont like about these headphones. I was really torn between Bose and the top of the line beats and then even some skullcandys. I dont think that for my style of listening I could have picked a better set, especially at this price point. I listen to a lot of rock, rap, and instrumental jams and these handle all of them very well. I will say that if you dont use a streaming service that offers high quality audio files, like Amazon music or Tidal, you might not hear the difference. These headphones do have very nice controls and easy pairing for people that are on the move and need to be able to do things without searching for buttons. Overall Im incredibly happy with my purchase and have 0 complaints!!

Pretty good headphones for the price, only complaint is that my ear actually rubs against the speakers on the inside and it starts to hurt after a while. The headphones themselves are not uncomfortable but personally does hurt my ears after extended use.
At first I was skeptical but it turn out to be great headphone. Noise cancellation works great so far.
I love these headphones the second I put them on. For me they are hands down the best bang for your buck. The controls are easy to remember and the battery life is awesome.
Static due related to noise cancellation on the right side after a few months rendering the headphones unusable.

I love everything about these head phones except for the peak volume.  I'm old school metalhead & I need just a bit more in the volume dept.  Other wise totally kick a$$. I rock the heck outta em..... great 2 jam U tube off the phone.

I am a developer who uses my headphones daily for team calls and listening to music or audio books while working anywhere from 5-8 hours a day. I also tried these with gaming but the Mic issues prevent this from being possible. The Highlights: Battery: Excellent can go multiple days without charge. Comfort: Can go a full day with out any or much discomfort. Sound Quality: Sound quality for listening to Audio books and music is great in my opinion. The Disappointment: Microphone: Awful, every time I hop on a call my teammates complain they can not hear me or I sound like I am far away. Since I can't use these headphones for calls I end up using a different pair for work all together. Noise Canceling: Not true noise canceling, only blocks some sounds. Controls: I am not a fan of the swipe controls often when I am trying to pause music it takes 4-5 tries and I end up skipping a song or turning the volume up instead. Summary: I gave this 2 stars b/c I can't really use the device for what I purchased it, I loved my old Sony headphones which is why I spent a little bit extra for an upgrade. But I was disappointed, with the mic and noise cancellation.

I've had these headphones for 4 months and have been using them regularly. They're ok, not great. For the price, I'd recommend going with Bose QuietComfort. Headphones are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The sound quality is ok, not fantastically crisp and they're fairly bass-heavy, which is a matter of personal preference as to whether you like that or not. However I have two main gripes that bother me about these headphones. 1) the noise cancelling feature is pretty bad. Compared to Bose noise-cancelling, these don't even hold a candle. I hear a lot of ambient noise, even when on the full noise-cancelling mode. It's irritating as I expected much better from Sony on this feature. 2) the bass-heavy sound also distorts the sound at times. I use these for work, music and watching television (when my wife is asleep). I've noticed that with music and television, when there is a bass-heavy track or scene, the rest of the audio sounds staticky, which is also frustrating.

Excellent headphones. Better than expected. The both Google and alexa assistants work as advertised. Watched Kong vs Godzilla and the sounds were amazing. Really puts you into the movie. My only complaint is this being a Sony product and can't connect to the Playstation. Super L in my opinion. Otherwise great headphones!!!

bose.review: Got this as an early Christmas gift for my papa but Im quite disappointed. The sound quality is nothing compared to the Bose ones that I got for my brother. Also, the inside of the headphones are made with cheap material so you really need to handle with care or else it will get scratched off.

So glad I held off on getting the Bose headphones. These are amazing. Comfortable and really works without feeling youre underwater. Nice idea on the  volume control (slide your finger up the cup) and good battery life (enough for most flights. Great value and Im getting a second pair for my family members.
Low volume and no noise cancellation. I could still here the awful gym music despite having these cranked up to highest volume and noise cancellation ON. Nothing like the Bose quite comfort 35.
Just average for the price, is good for everyone who's looking for less than perfection, I rather exchange quality than price, I bought the Bose noise cancelling model 35 IIA

I have bought many Sony products in the past and have been very pleased.  My husband and son have Bose wireless, noise cancellation headphones, which I'd been borrowing.  Literally, when I vacuumed, I could not hear the motor.  NOT so with the Sony.  I followed the instructions, downloaded the app, and adjusted the noise cancellation.  I could tap my finger on the counter and hear it while wearing the headphones and listening to music or an audio book.  I was very disappointed.  I returned the Sony headphones and ordered Bose instead.  (BOSE 35 II)

earphone.review: I had a moderate TBI from a car accident and noise reduction ear phones were recommended to me to assist with my symptoms. These have been very beneficial for me, especially when Im vacuuming or involved in any other activities that include loud noises. Music is crystal clear.

Here I am in my 70s and just now getting my first set of noise-canceling earphones.  Just LOVE these.  I received them yesterday and I like being on a different floor and still talking to Alexa.  Frankly, I like everything about these earphones.  I found the instruction manual online because my eyes arent that great to read the paper one.  I like the Sony app that goes with it and how simple pairing is.  What else .  Im getting more housework done because listening to music while you work is motivating.

headset.review: I absolutely love this headset. I have read many reviews where people claim that that Noise cancellation is nowhere near as good as the XM3 and that the sound is bass heavy. It won't make sense to have noise cancellation as good as the XM3 coz if that is the case, then obviously people would buy the XM3, ain't it? Sure this is an Xtra Bass (XB) and that means the sound is bass heavy. I have had quite a few Xtra Bass earphones and headphones and I am extremely happy with them, which is why I opted for this. For a normal person like me, the Xtra Bass make the music very lively. What made it absolutely worth it, is the fact that I got these for $128 (48% off), which is an absolute steal.. If there was anything to crib about, then it has to be the fact that Sony did not include fast charging for this headphones, which is quite a bummer when considering the fact that these retail for $250..

Audio quality is decent and battery life is superb.  However, the prior model WH-CH700N is a better buy.  The 900N just feels cheaper and flimsier.  The noise canceling isn't as good, either.  The lack of physical buttons might appeal to some but I find a bit of turn off; accidentally skips and stops happen way more than with the prior version.  I bought this to replace my 700N that was stolen... Feels like I've been robbed twice, now.
Sounded great but not good ventilation. My ears well sweating like a hooker sitting  in a church.

I really love the headset. One weird thing that happens though is when I turn it on and connect to my iPhone, it increases the volume to max volume for a few seconds and then it decreases. I dont know if its done software glitch

This headset is nice , but seamless switching b/w devices is not there. I bought this headset by seeing on the box that it is made for iPhone and iPad. I use all apple products. If you have mac book and iphone with you  , once you are connected to mac book you can't switch to iPhone by selecting on iPhone unless you switch the bluetooth off in mac book. It's giving really hard time if you are using multiple devices and your requirement is about switching b/w devices. Sound quality is good, no ear pains, once it is connected everything works fine.

The only thing that is disappointing about these is the noise cancellation which is fairly unimpressive overall.  It will drown out mild white noise, but in traffic or on the street you still hear a lot

Great audio quality, but do not expect to use the headset microphone with your laptop. The mic works great with my phone, but you will be inaudible to the difference when using MS Teams or Zoom. Many other users reported the same issue in the Song community

The noise canceling is barely any better than when the headset is turned off. I'm not impressed. also the touch countrols seem cool in theory but they're unresponsive when you need them and WAY too sensitive when you don't.

review_types.best_review: I have been looking and researching for a quality wireless noise cancellation headphone without having to spend a fortune for several months.  I came across the Sony WH-XB900N and I was hooked.  As a musician I enjoy extra bass in the sound as you are not listening to the music, you are experiencing it.  If you want to hear the song as the artist intended it the Sony WH-XB900N is the right choice.
review_types.worst_review: They sent me the replacement immediately after I got in contact and it was more than appreciated especially during this time. The only way I keep in contact with friends and family so I can hear them if Im busy with work and from the free time that I have.
review_types.neutral: I loved using these headphones and treated them as gently, but the left ear completely gave out after about 5 months. Never dropped it or bumped it, just put it down on my desk and when I picked it up again it wasnt working. Considering I treated them like a newborn, it certainly makes me question the manufacture, and wouldnt recommend them to someone who is more on the go or looking for a long-term headphone.
